Title: Asterisk DNS SRV and NAPTR Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can issue a specially crafted dns_srv and dns_naptr request to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target service to crash.

Jan Hoffmann reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-010.html

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center) Linux Kernel IP Fragment Reassembly Algorithm Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linux kernel. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system. Cisco Unified Contact Center is affected.
The system uses an inefficient IP fragment reassembly algorithm. A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented data to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

Juha-Matti Tilli (Aalto University, Department of Communications and Networking / Nokia Bell Labs) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180824-linux-ip-fragment

Title: Microsoft Skype for Business Audio File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Skype for Business in a third party component. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will conduct an on-premise X.509 validation attack against the AudioCodes algorithm and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The phone remains functional throughout the attack.

Micha Borrmann (SySS GmbH) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Open Redirect Flaw Lets Remote Users Redirect the Target User's Browser to an Arbitrary Site
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvj48070, CSCvj56757, CSCvj56760, and CSCvj59218 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20181003-er-ucm-redirect

Title: Asterisk Stack Overflow in HTTP Websocket Upgrade Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to request an HTTP websocket upgrade that triggers a stack overflow in the 'res_http_websocket.so' module and causes the target service to consume all available stack memory.

Sean Bright reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.23.1, 14.7.8, 15.6.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-009.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service XCP Router Service Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 7400 to trigger a buffer over-read and cause the XCP Router service to crash and restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg97663 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180815-ucmimps-dos

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvk15343 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180801-ucm-xss

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Obtain Passwords
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain passwords on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user [CVE-2018-0402].

The web-based management interface prefills the password field with a previously saved password from an internal database [CVE-2018-0403. A remote user can view the HTML source to retrieve a cleartext password on the target system.

The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0400, CVE-2018-0401]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg70904, CSCvg70921, CSCvg70967, and CSCvg71040 to these vulnerabilities.

Filip Waeytens from NCI Agency Cyber Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

A remote user can obtain passwords on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180718-uccx

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi55878 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-ucmim-ps-csrf

Title: Asterisk Endpoint Specific ACL Response Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
When the system is configured with endpoint-specific access control list (ACL) rules, a remote user can send a SIP request to cause the system to return a 403 Forbidden response, disclosing the existence of the PJSIP endpoint to the remote user.

John reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information about PJSIP endpoints on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.21.1, 14.7.7, 15.4.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-008.html

Title: Asterisk TCP/TLS iostream Read Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data via TCP/TLS or abruptly disconnect to trigger an iostream read error and cause the target service to enter an infinite loop and become unusable.

Sean Bright reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to become unusable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.4.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-007.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Frame Scripting Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-frame scripting attacks.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load content from the target system within an HTML iframe and attempt to conduct cross-site scripting, cross-site request forgery, clickjacking, or phishing attacks.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg19761 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can load valid content from the target system within an HTML iframe and attempt to conduct cross-site scripting, cross-site request forgery, clickjacking, or phishing attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180606-cucm-xfs

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web framework does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Certain parameters sent via the HTTP GET and HTTP POST methods are affected. 

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg89116 to this vulnerability.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain LDAP Credentials
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can load a specific URL to exploit a flaw in the web framework and obtain potentially sensitive information, including LDAP credentials, on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf22116 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain LDAP credentials on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-ucm1

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager HTTP Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can load a specially crafted URL to obtain potentially configuration parameter information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf20218 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive configuration information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-ucm

Title: Asterisk 'fmtp' Validation Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SDP message body with an invalid 'fmtp' attribute to trigger an error in pjproject and cause the target service to crash.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.19.2, 14.7.6, 15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-003.html

Title: Asterisk WebSocket Payload Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly read WebSocket frames with a zero payload length. A remote authenticated user can exploit this to cause the system to enter a busy loop until the underlying connection is closed.

The default configuration does not enable the vulnerable HTTP server component.

Sean Bright reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-006.html

Title: Asterisk Media Format Parsing Error in 'pjproject' Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SDP message with an invalid media format description to trigger a parsing error in pjproject and cause the target service to crash.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.19.2, 14.7.6, 15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-002.html

Title: Asterisk Transport Connection Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user can send multiple INVITE messages via TCP or TLS and then close the connection suddenly to trigger a segmentation fault.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.19.2, 14.7.6, 15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-005.html

Title: Asterisk Accept Header Processing Error in 'res_pjsip_pubsub' Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a SUBSCRIBE request with specially crafted Accept headers to trigger a flaw in the 'res_pjsip_pubsub' module and cause the target service to crash. More than 32 Accept headers can trigger a crash.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.19.2, 14.7.6, 15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-004.html

Title: Asterisk Payload Negotiation Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted RTP data during SDP negotiation to trigger a payload number error and cause the target service to crash.

Sebastien Duthil reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.2.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2018-001.html

Title: Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal IVR Connection Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP connection request to the target Interactive Voice Response (IVR) management connection interface to cause the IVR connection to the Customer Voice Portal (CVP) to disconnect. As a result, the CVP will not accept new inbound calls while the connection is disconnected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve70560 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the CVP to fail to accept new inbound calls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5(1)SR0(12)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180221-cvp

Title: Microsoft Skype Update Mechanism DLL Hijacking Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Skype. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can place a specially crafted DLL in the '[SystemRoot]\Temp\' directory. When the Skype update mechanism ('[ProgramFiles]\Skype\Updater\Updater.exe') runs, arbitrary code will be executed with System privileges.

The vendor was notified on September 2, 2017.

Stefan Kanthak reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix in a future product version.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Unspecified Input Validation Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger an input validation flaw and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

Description:

The web framework does not properly protect database tables. A remote user can load a specially crafted URL to view potentially sensitive data library information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh66592 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive data library information on the target system.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. This can be exploited to determine the presence of certain values in the database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg74810 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal Application Server SIP INVITE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP INVITE request to the target portal when communicating with the Cisco Virtualized Voice Browser (VVB) to affect the availability of services and data on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve85840 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180110-ucm

Title: Asterisk PJSIP Channel Driver Contact Header Processing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data without a contact header to trigger an error in the PJSIP channel driver and cause the service to crash.

On systems with authentication enabled, authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.

Ross Beer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.5, 14.7.5, 15.1.5).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2017-014.html

Title: Asterisk Bug in Processing RTCP Packets Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can establish a call to the target system and send a specially crafted compound RTCP packet containing more than one report to trigger a memory error and cause the target service to crash.

Tzafrir Cohen and Vitezslav Novy reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.4, 14.7.4, 15.1.4).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-012.html

Title: Asterisk chan_skinny Driver Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the chan_skinny (SCCP protocol) channel driver and consume excessive virtual memory on the target system, causing the service to stop processing requests.

Juan Sacco reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources to cause asterisk to stop processing requests.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.3, 14.7.3, 15.1.3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-013.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf79346 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CallManager) software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf36682 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-ucm

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Upgrade Error Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
When a refresh upgrade is performed  on a Cisco Voice Operating System (VOS) software platform device, an engineering flag remains enabled. As a result, a remote user can connect to the target device via SFTP and gain root privileges on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg55112 to this vulnerability.

Quentin Rhoads-Herrera and Rich Mirch of the State Farm Penetration Testing Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor notes that when the system upgraded using the standard upgrade method to an Engineering Special Release, service update, or a new major release, the vulnerability is corrected.

The vendor also notes that Engineering Special Releases that are installed as COP files do not correct the vulnerability.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-vos

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Upgrade Error Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
When a refresh upgrade or Prime Collaboration Deployment (PCD) migration is performed  on a Cisco Voice Operating System (VOS) software platform device, an engineering flag remains enabled. As a result, a remote user can connect to the target device via SFTP and gain root privileges on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg22923 to this vulnerability.

Quentin Rhoads-Herrera and Rich Mirch of the State Farm Penetration Testing Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor notes that when the system upgraded using the standard upgrade method to an Engineering Special Release, service update, or a new major release, the vulnerability is corrected.

The vendor also notes that Engineering Special Releases that are installed as COP files do not correct the vulnerability.

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-vos

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in pjproject Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted Cseq and Via header port number values to trigger a buffer overflow in the pjproject parsing code to cause the target Asterisk service to crash.

The vendor was notified on October 5, 2017.

Youngsung Kim at LINE Corporation reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.1, 14.7.1, 15.1.1).

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2017-009.html

Description:

A remote user can trigger a file descriptor and RTP port leak in the processing of Asterisk pjsip session objects to consume excessive resources on the target system.

Correy Farrell reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive file descriptor and RTP port resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.1, 14.7.1, 15.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2017-011.html

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in Processing Party B CDR User Data Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Party B user field CDR data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

System using CDRs and the 'X-ClientCode' header within a SIP INFO message when using chan_sip and the 'useclientcode' option is enabled, the CDR dialplan function executed from AMI when setting the user field, and the AMI Monitor action when using a long file name/path are affected.

Richard Mudgett reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.18.1, 14.7.1, 15.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2017-010.html

The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-frame scripting attacks.
The web-based user interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in HTML inline frames (i.e., iframes) before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve60993 to this vulnerability.

Loudiyi Mohamed reported this vulnerability.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to exploit a flaw in the Operations, Administration, Maintenance, and Provisioning (OAMP) credential reset function to gain administrator privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve92752 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain administrator privileges on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix.

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache Struts. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted XML data to trigger a deserialization flaw in the REST Plugin in XStream and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Man Yue Mo reported this vulnerability.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache Struts. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system. Cisco Emergency Responder is affected.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL in a form field to trigger an error in regular expression (regex) processing and consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

Adam Cazzolla and Jonathan Bullock reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170907-struts2

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted URL containing SQL statements to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb58973 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bug in Trust Verification Service Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted incomplete streams to trigger a TLS processing flaw in the Trust Verification Service (TVS) and prevent access to the TVS. A service restart is required to return the service to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux21905 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target Trust Verification Service (TVS).
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-ucm

Title: Asterisk Input Validation Flaw in 'pjsip_message_ip_updater' Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URI in a 'From', 'To', and 'Contact' header to trigger a flaw in 'pjsip_message_ip_updater' and cause the target service to crash.

Ross Beer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.17.1, 14.6.1).

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-007.html

Title: Asterisk Input Validation Flaw in 'app_minivm' Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted caller-id name and number data to trigger an input validation flaw in the 'app_minivm' module and execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

Corey Farrell reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.25.2, 13.17.1, 14.6.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-006.html

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can hijack the target media session.
A remote user can send specially crafted RTP traffic to exploit a flaw in the strict RTP support feature and provide and receive media from the session.

Klaus-Peter Junghanns reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can hijack the target media session.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.25.3, 13.17.2, 14.6.2)

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-008.html

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can modify configuration data.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a Role Based Access Control (RBAC) flaw to modify the configuration data for another user on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve27331 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration data for a different user on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-ucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Traverse the Directory to View Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The the web framework does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located in the web root directory structure.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve13796 to this vulnerability.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view files in the web root directory structure on the target system.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) service uses clear text authentication via an unsecured HTTP port. A remote user can masquerade as a valid user to gain access to the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw86638 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can masquerade as a valid user and gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-ucce

Title: Asterisk SCCP Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted SCCP packets to trigger a boundary error and consume excessive memory on the target system.

Systems using chan_skinny are affected.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.15.1, 14.4.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-004.txt

Title: Asterisk Processing Flaw in PJSIP Multi-part Body Parser Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to trigger a logic error in the multi-part body parser in PJSIP and cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in the PJSIP component.

Systems using chan_sip are not affected.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.15.1, 14.4.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-003.txt

Title: Asterisk PJSIP Algorithm Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a SIP packet with a specially crafted CSeq header and a Via header with no branch parameter to trigger a buffer overflow in the PJSIP RFC 2543 transaction key generation algorithm and cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in the PJSIP component.

Systems using chan_sip are not affected.

Sandro Gauci reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.15.1, 14.4.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2017-002.txt

A remote user can exploit a configuration restriction in the toll-fraud protections component to place unauthorized, long-distance phone calls via the target system.

Title: Microsoft Skype Library Loading Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System in Certain Cases
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network

A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL. When the target user installs Skype from the same directory as the specially crafted DLL (e.g., "Downloads"), the DLL will load and Skype will execute arbitrary code in the DLL.

A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The User Options portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb70033 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.5(2.15900.2), 11.0(1.23900.3), 11.0(1.23900.5), 12.0(0.98000.507)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170315-ucm1

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The serviceability page is affected [CVE-2017-3821].

The web management interface is affected [CVE-2017-3828, CVE-2017-3829].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvc49348, CSCvb98777, and CSCvc30999 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Asterisk Lets Remote Users Bypass Proxy Authentication to Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can bypass proxy authentication.
The chan_sip channel driver defines whitespace differently than a SIP proxy. As a result, if Asterisk is configured behind a SIP proxy, a remote user can supply specially crafted SIP header values to bypass proxy authentication and provide an INVITE request to the target Asterisk system.

Systems using dialog-aware proxies are not affected.

Systems using chan_pjsip rather than chan_sip are not affected.

Walter Doekes reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass proxy authentication to access the target system in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.25.1, 13.13.1, 14.2.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/ASTERISK-2016-009.html

Title: Asterisk Message Parsing Flaw in sdp_fmtp_get() Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Session Description Protocol (SDP) offer or SDP answer message with parameters separated using a space character and using the Opus codec to trigger a parsing error in sdp_fmtp_get() and cause the target service to enter a recursive loop and crash. The target system does not need to be configured for Opus.

Systems with guests enabled for chan_sip or anonymous enabled for chan_pjsip are affected by remote users without authentication.

jorgen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.13.1, 14.2.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2016-008.html

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) ntp Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
On Windows-based systems with the trap service enabled, a remote user can send a specially crafted packet to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the ntpd daemon to crash [CVE-2016-9311].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control mode packet to set and unset ntpd traps. As a result, a remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, conduct denial of service amplification attacks, or cause monitoring to become disabled [CVE-2016-9310].

A remote user with access to the target NTP broadcast domain can inject specially crafted broadcast mode NTP packets into the NTP broadcast domain to exploit a flaw in the replay prevention function cause the target ntpd daemon to reject broadcast mode NTP packets from legitimate NTP broadcast servers [CVE-2016-7427].

A remote user with access to the target NTP broadcast domain can inject specially crafted broadcast mode NTP packets into the NTP broadcast domain to exploit a flaw in the broadcast mode poll interval enforcement function and cause the target ntpd daemon to reject broadcast mode NTP packets from legitimate NTP broadcast servers [CVE-2016-7428].

A remote user can send a specially crafted, large UDP packet to cause the target ntpd daemon to stop functioning [CVE-2016-9312]. Windows based systems are affected.

A regression error exists in the validation of zero origin timestamps [CVE-2016-7431].

On systems with ntpd configured to allow mrulist query requests from the remote user, a remote user can send a specially crafted mrulist query request packet to cause the target ntpd daemon to crash [CVE-2016-7434].

On systems with multiple interfaces on separate networks and where the operating system does not validate source addresses in received packets, a remote user can send a specially crafted packet to trigger an error in selecting the proper interface and temporarily prevent the target ntpd daemon from sending new requests [CVE-2016-7429].

On systems with ntpd configured with rate limiting for all associations, a remote user can send packets with specially crafted source addresses to keep the rate limiting function active and prevent the target ntpd daemon from accepting valid responses [CVE-2016-7426].

An error may occur in the calculation of root sync delay, causing the jitter value to be higher than expected [CVE-2016-7433].

Matthew Van Gundy of Cisco ASIG, Robert Pajak of ABB, Magnus Stubman, Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat, Brian Utterback of Oracle, and Sharon Goldberg and Aanchal Malhotra of Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system.

A remote user can conduct denial of service amplification attacks against other targets.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for CVE-2016-7433, CVE-2016-9310, and CVE-2016-9311 for Cisco Unified Communications Manager and Cisco Unified Communications Manager Session Management Edition.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161123-ntpd

Title: Asterisk RTP Session Management Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Consume Excessive Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can cause RTP resources to be allocated before old RTP resources are released, consuming excessive RTP resources on the target system and preventing new RTP sessions.

Systems using the overlap dialing feature in chan_sip are affected when used with a device that has authenticated RTP resources.

Systems without the overlap dialing feature are also affected when the remote user sends an in-dialog INVITE after receiving a 404 response but before sending an ACK message.

Etienne Lessard reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can prevent new RTP sessions from being established on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.23.1, 13.11.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2016-007.html

Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote or remote authenticated user can modify time on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted crypto-NAK packets with a spoofed source address of an existing peer to trigger an error in 'ntp_proto.c' and cause the preemptable client association to be demobilized [CVE-2016-1547].

A remote user can send a spoofed packet with a specially crafted timestamp to cause the target ntpd client to reject future server responses from the spoofed server. As a result, the remote user can modify the time of the target client or cause denial of service conditions on the target client [CVE-2016-1548].

A remote authenticated peer can create an arbitrary number of ephemeral associations to modify the time on the target system [CVE-2016-1549].

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted messages to potentially recover the message digest key [CVE-2016-1550].

A remote user can send specially crafted spoofed packets to a target system that fails to implement martian packet filtering to modify the time on the target system [CVE-2016-1551].

A remote user with knowledge of the controlkey (for ntpq) or the requestkey (for ntpdc) can create a specially crafted session to cause ntpd to crash in certain cases [CVE-2016-2516].

A remote authenticated user with knowledge of the of the controlkey (for ntpq) or the requestkey (for ntpdc) can create a specially crafted session to prevent ntpd from processing authentication requests until the process is restarted [CVE-2016-2517].

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to trigger an out-of-bounds memory reference error in the MATCH_ASSOC() function when creating a peer association with hmode > 7 [CVE-2016-2518].

A remote authenticated user can cause a specially crafted data value to be stored by ntpd and then cause ntpd to crash when attempting to read the value via ctl_getitem() [CVE-2016-2519].

Matt Street, Matthew Van Gundy, Stephen Gray, Jonathan Gardner, and others of Cisco ASIG, Yihan Lian (of the Cloud Security Team, Qihoo 360), Miroslav Lichvar of RedHat, Michael Tatarinov (NTP Project Developer Volunteer), and Loganaden Velvindron reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote or remote authenticated user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160428-ntpd

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in libSRTP Lets Remote Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Secure Real-Time Transport Protocol (SRTP) packet to trigger an integer underflow in the encryption processing subsystem of the SRTP library (libSRTP) and cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux00716 to this vulnerability.

Systems configured with SRTP are affected.

Other Cisco products are affected.

Randell Jesup with the Mozilla team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.5(2)SU3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160420-libsrtp

Title: Asterisk PJProject TCP Connection Processing Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause the target service to crash or stop processing traffic.
PJProject limits the number of TCP connections and also does not properly close TCP connections. A remote user can open multiple TCP connections to the target service but send no data to consume all available connections.

If PJProject was compiled in debug mode, the target service will crash.

If PJProject was not compiled in debug mode, the target service will reject any additional TCP connection requests and will fail to process TCP-based SIP traffic.

UDP-based SIP traffic is not affected.

chan_sip is not affected.

George Joseph reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to stop accepting TCP connections, preventing any TCP-based SIP traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.8.1; 13.1-cert5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2016-005.html

Title: Asterisk REGISTER Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user can submit a REGISTER request with a Contact header containing a specially crafted URI to cause the target Asterisk service to crash.

Systems using PJSIP as the SIP stack are affected.

The chan_sip module is not affected.

George Joseph reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.8.1; 13.1-cert5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2016-004.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets to the target device to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to eventually reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuj23293 and CSCuv39370 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(2)su4, 10.5(2)su3, 11.0(1)su1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160323-sip

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) Glibc getaddrinfo() Stack Overflow Lets Remote or Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the getaddrinfo() function in the glibc DNS client resolver code ('resolv/nss_dns') and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application using the glibc library.

Various applications may be affected, including ssh, sudo, and curl.

Additional information is available at:

https://googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com/2016/02/cve-2015-7547-glibc-getaddrinfo-stack.html
Impact': A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuy32014 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160218-glibc

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web framework does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Emergency Responder software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy10766 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Emergency Responder software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160215-er

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise) OpenSSL Flaws Let Remote Users Recover DH Keys in Certain Cases and Let Remote Users Negotiate Disabled Ciphers
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can recover keys in certain cases. A remote user can negotiate disabled ciphers. Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise is affected.
The system may use primes for generating Diffie Hellman (DH) parameters that are not safe when using X9.42 style parameter files [CVE-2016-0701]. A remote user that complete multiple handshakes with the target peer where the peer uses the same private DH exponent may be able to determine the target peer's private DH exponent and then conduct man-in-the-middle attacks against the ostensibly secure connection.

Systems that reuse the private DH exponent or use a static DH ciphersuite are affected.

Systems with the SSL_OP_SINGLE_DH_USE option for ephemeral DH (DHE) in TLS disabled reuse the same private DH exponent for the life of the server process and are affected.

Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on January 12, 2016

Antonio Sanso (Adobe) reported this vulnerability.

When the SSLv2 protocol is not disabled via SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 on the target server, a remote user can negotiate SSLv2 ciphers that have been disabled on the target server [CVE-2015-3197]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

The vendor was notified on December 26, 2015.

Nimrod Aviram and Sebastian Schinzel reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can recover keys in certain cases.

A remote user can negotiate disabled ciphers.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue a fix (11.51 in June 2016).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160129-openssl

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) OpenSSL Flaws Let Remote Users Recover DH Keys in Certain Cases and Let Remote Users Negotiate Disabled Ciphers
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can recover keys in certain cases. A remote user can negotiate disabled ciphers. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
The system may use primes for generating Diffie Hellman (DH) parameters that are not safe when using X9.42 style parameter files [CVE-2016-0701]. Systems with the SSL_OP_SINGLE_DH_USE option for ephemeral DH (DHE) in TLS disabled reuse the same private DH exponent for the life of the server process and are affected.

Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on January 12, 2016

Antonio Sanso (Adobe) reported this vulnerability.

When the SSLv2 protocol is not disabled via SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 on the target server, a remote user can negotiate SSLv2 ciphers that have been disabled on the target server [CVE-2015-3197]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.
