Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Key Management Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can obtain an encryption key that is stored in plain text and then use the key to decrypt potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv85926, CSCuv85929, CSCuv85931, CSCuv85949, CSCuv85958, and CSCuv85998 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160208-ucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Key Management Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can obtain an encryption key that is stored in plain text and then use the key to decrypt potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The following models and versions are affected:

Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CallManager) Releases 10.5(2.12901.1), 10.5(2.10000.5), 11.0(1.10000.10), and 9.1(2.10000.28)

Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service Release 10.5(2)

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv85926, CSCuv85929, CSCuv85931, CSCuv85949, CSCuv85958, and CSCuv85998 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160208-ucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Access Control Flaw in Web Framework Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL to exploit a database table access control flaw in the web framework and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system, including entity and table names.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy11098 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system, including database entity and table names.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-201600208-ucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux99227 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160203-ucm

Title: Asterisk UDPTL FAX Packet Redundancy Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user can trigger a flaw in the processing of UDPTL FAX data to cause an invalid memory access. As a result, the target service will crash.

Walter Dokes and Torrey Searle reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.21.1, 13.7.1, 11.6-cert12, 13.1-cert3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2016-003.html

Title: Asterisk chan_sip File Descriptor Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive File Descriptor Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can trigger an integer overflow to create large retransmit timeout values and consume excessive file descriptor resources on the target system.

Alexander Traud reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive file descriptor resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.21.1, 13.7.1, 11.6-cert12, 13.1-cert3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2016-002.html

Title: Asterisk Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL/TLS Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions in certain cases.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.

This vulnerability is known as the BEAST vulnerability.

Thai Duong and Juliano Rizzo reported this vulnerability.

Alex A. Welz reported that Asterisk is affected by this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.21.1, 13.7.1; 11.6-cert12, 13.1-cert3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2016-001.html

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express XMPP Default User Account Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can use a default user account and static password to connect via Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) to the target system.

The default user account is created during installation. The account password cannot be changed.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw79085 and CSCuw86638 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160202-fducce

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Input Validation Flaw in Management Interface Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The HTTP web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux92033 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160125-ucce

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
A specific page does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut66767 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160105-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Web Applications Identity Management Subsystem Lets Remote Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted session tokens to the target Web Applications Identity Management subsystem to cause denial of service conditions on the target subsystem. The subsystem must be restarted to return to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul83786 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target subsystem. The subsystem must be restarted to return to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151215-ucmim

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Web Management Interface Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Web Management Interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu15266 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151214-ucm

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv26501 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151209-cers

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Directory Traversal Bug in Tools Menu Lets Remote Authenticated Users Upload Arbitrary Files to the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit an input validation flaw in the Tools menu to upload files to arbitrary locations the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv21781 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can upload arbitrary files to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151209-ert

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Lets Remote Users Upload Arbitrary Files to the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can upload files to the target system.
A remote user can exploit an input validation flaw in the web framework to upload arbitrary files to a restricted location on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv25501 to this vulnerability.
Impact': arbitrary files to a restricted location on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151209-erw

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager MRA Services Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Control of the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can take control of the target system.
A remote user can spoof a target user's identity to exploit an identity validation flaw in edge devices using the Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) services to take ownership of the target edge device. This can be exploited to setup and receive voice calls acting as the target registered user.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager Mobile and Remote Access Edge Devices are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu97283 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can setup and receive voice calls acting as the target registered user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151209-ucm

Title: Microsoft Skype Font File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Skype. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Steven Vittitoe of Google Project Zero reported two of the vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create a font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-128

Title: Microsoft Skype for Business Lets Remote Users Bypass Sandbox Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Skype for Business. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the instantiation of Office applications via COM controls to gain elevated privileges and bypass of the Internet Explorer sandbox.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the sandbox restrictions of Internet Explorer.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-116

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified Contact Center) Apache Struts Bugs Permit Remote Code Execution and URL Redirection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Apache Struts. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct URL redirection attacks. Cisco Unified Contact Center is affected.
A remote user can submit a URL with specially crafted 'action:', 'redirect:' or 'redirectAction:' parameter values to cause the system to evaluate the values as an OGNL expression and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-2251].

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/struts2-blank/example/X.action?action:%25{(new+java.lang.ProcessBuilder(new+java.lang.String[]{'command','goes','here'})).start()}

A remote user can create a URL with specially crafted 'redirect:' or 'redirectAction:' parameter values that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site [CVE-2013-2248].

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/struts2-showcase/fileupload/upload.action?redirect:http://[attacker]/

Takeshi Terada of Mitsui Bussan Secure Directions, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can conduct URL redirection attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for CVE-2013-2251 for Cisco Unified Contact Center (10.5(1), 8.5(4)ES37, 9.0(4)ES39, 9.0(3)ES13, 10.0(1)ES10, 10.0(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131023-struts2

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service REST Interface Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw31632 to this vulnerability.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut41766 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40217

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in 'ccmivr' Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in certain parameters used by the ccmivr page before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut19580 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Communications Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted AVVID XML Layer (AXL) session requests at a high rate to cause the target management page to become slow or unresponsive.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu99709 to this vulnerability.

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) OpenSSL Alternative Certificate Chain Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Forge Certificates
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
When the validation of a certificate chain fails, the system attempts to validate an alternate certificate chain but does not check the CA flag of untrusted certificates. As a result, a remote user can cause the target system to validate an invalid certificate using a valid leaf certificate.

Applications that verify certificates are affected.

SSL/TLS/DTLS clients and SSL/TLS/DTLS servers using client authentication are affected.

The vendor was notified on June 24, 2015.

Adam Langley/David Benjamin (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager (UCM) and Cisco UCM Session Management Edition (SME).

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv26281 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150710-openssl

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system. Cisco Emergency Responder is affected.
When the validation of a certificate chain fails, the system attempts to validate an alternate certificate chain but does not check the CA flag of untrusted certificates. As a result, a remote user can cause the target system to validate an invalid certificate using a valid leaf certificate.

Applications that verify certificates are affected.

SSL/TLS/DTLS clients and SSL/TLS/DTLS servers using client authentication are affected.

The vendor was notified on June 24, 2015.

Adam Langley/David Benjamin (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv26293 to this vulnerability.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150710-openssl

Description:

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands and Obtain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The web interface does not properly restrict access. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-4221].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq46194 to this vulnerability.

The system does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2015-4222]. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq46325 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=39506

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise is affected.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted application data to a connected DTLS peer between the ChangeCipherSpec and Finished messages to trigger an invalid memory free and cause a segmentation fault or memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-8176]. Versions 0.9.8 prior to 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 prior to 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 prior to 1.0.1h are affected.

Praveen Kariyanahalli and Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert of Google separately reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted ECParameters to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2015-1788]. Applications that process public keys, certificate requests, or certificates are affected. TLS clients and TLS servers with client authentication enabled are affected. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

Joseph Birr-Pixton reported this vulnerability on April 6, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted certificate or certificate revocation list (CRL) that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an out-of-bound memory read in X509_cmp_time() and cause a segmentation fault [CVE-2015-1789]. TLS clients that verify CRLs are affected. TLS clients and servers with client authentication enabled and that use custom verification callbacks may be affected.

Robert Swiecki of Google reported this vulnerability on April 8, 2015 and Hanno Bock independently reported this vulnerability on April 11, 2015.

A remote user can create specially crafted ASN.1-encoded PKCS#7 data with a missing EnvelopedContent component to trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2015-1790]. Applications that decrypt or parse PKCS#7 data from untrusted sources are affected. OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected. The impact was not specified.

Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability on April 18, 2015.

A remote user can create a specially crafted signedData message that specifies an unknown hash function OID to trigger an infinite loop in the CMS code [CVE-2015-1792]. Applications that verify signedData messages using the CMS code are affected.

Johannes Bauer reported this vulnerability on March 31, 2015.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target application to crash or enter an infinite loop.

A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The impact of one vulnerability was not disclosed.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuu82335 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150612-openssl

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise) OpenSSL Double Free Memory Error in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket() Has Unspecified Impact
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. The impact was not specified. Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise is affected.
A remote server can return a specially crafted NewSessionTicket message to a connected multi-threaded client to cause the client to attempt to reuse a previous ticket and trigger a race condition. As a result, a double free memory error may occur in ssl3_get_new_session_ticket().

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuu82335 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150612-openssl

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut66725 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38964

Description:

Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

Description:

A local user can supply specially crafted command parameter values to exploit a local read file bug and obtain a root shell on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut19546 to this vulnerability.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The 'deviceProfileEdit.do' and 'phoneEdit.do' pages are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCut33447 and CSCut33608 to this vulnerability.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The Interactive Voice Response (IVR) interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

Title: Asterisk TLS Certificate Validation Flaw With Null Byte in Common Name Lets Remote Users Bypass Certificate Validation
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can bypass certificate validation.
The system does not properly validate certificates when connecting to a SIP TLS device. A remote server can supply a specially crafted certificate with a common name containing a null byte to spoof a different common name and cause the certificate to be accepted by the target user's system.

The vendor was notified on January 12, 2015.

Maciej Szmigiero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote server can bypass certificate validation on the target client.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.32.3, 11.17.1, 12.8.2, 13.3.2, 1.8.28-cert5, 11.6-cert11, 13.1-cert2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Call Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit an improper security restriction flaw to obtain arbitrary files from the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq44439 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38079

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) Glibc Buffer Overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() Lets Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus66650 [for Cisco UCM and Cisco UCM Session Management Edition (SME)] to this vulnerability.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-ghost

Title: Asterisk libcurl Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Conduct HTTP Response Splitting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to cause the target server to return a split response. A remote user can exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.

The underlying vulnerability resides in libcurl.

The vendor was notified on January 12, 2015.

Olle Johansson reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.

A remote authenticated user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.32.2, 11.15.1, 12.8.1, 13.1.1, 1.8.28-cert4, 11.6-cert10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2015-002.html

Title: Asterisk File Descriptor Leak Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send an SDP offer that lists codecs not allowed by Asterisk to consume RTP ports on the target system.

The PJSIP channel driver is affected.

The vendor was notified on January 6, 2015.

Y Ateya reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can consume RTP ports on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix (12.8.1, 13.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2015-001.html

A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted absolute path to a Real-Time Monitoring Tool (RTMT) API command to obtain arbitrary files from the target system.

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express) NTP Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in NTP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Contact Center Express is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target ntpd process.

A buffer overflow may occur in crypto_recv() when Autokey Authentication is enabled.

A buffer overflow may occur in ctl_putdata().

A buffer overflow may occur in configure().

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with the privileges of the ntpd process.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX).

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus26946 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express) NTP Logic Error in the receive() Function in 'ntp_proto.c' May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NTP. A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions. Cisco Unified Contact Center Express is affected.
A remote user may be able to trigger a certain and rare error to exploit a logic error in ntp_proto.c:receive() and adversely affect system integrity.

The vulnerability occurs due to a missing return statement.

[Editor's note: The vendor indicates that they have not be able to identify a method to affect system integrity.]

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to adversely affect system integrity.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX).

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus26946 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express) NTP Uses Weak Default Encryption Key and Weak RNG Seed
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in NTP. A remote user can access and modify data. Cisco Unified Contact Center Express is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can obtain encrypted data and decrypt it.

When no auth key is specified in the configuration file, the system generates a 31-bit key using a weak randomization function [CVE-2014-9293]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p11 [January 2010] are affected.

Neel Mehta of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.

The system uses a week seed for ntp-keygen to genearte symmetric keys [CVE-2014-9294]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p230 are affected [Nov 2011].

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access and modify data.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX).

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus26946 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) NTP Logic Error in the receive() Function in 'ntp_proto.c' May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NTP. A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
A remote user may be able to trigger a certain and rare error to exploit a logic error in ntp_proto.c:receive() and adversely affect system integrity.

The vulnerability occurs due to a missing return statement.

[Editor's note: The vendor indicates that they have not be able to identify a method to affect system integrity.]

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to adversely affect system integrity.
Solution:
Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) is affected. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus26858 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

A buffer overflow may occur in crypto_recv() when Autokey Authentication is enabled.

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.

Description:

A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can obtain encrypted data and decrypt it.

When no auth key is specified in the configuration file, the system generates a 31-bit key using a weak randomization function [CVE-2014-9293]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p11 [January 2010] are affected.

Neel Mehta of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.

The system uses a week seed for ntp-keygen to genearte symmetric keys [CVE-2014-9294]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p230 are affected [Nov 2011].

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access and modify data.

Title: Asterisk WebSocket Server Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service

A remote user can send a WebSocket frame with a specially crafted payload length of zero to trigger a flaw in the res_http_websocket module and to cause the target service to crash.

Badalian Vyacheslav reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target WebSocket service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.14.2, 12.7.2, 13.0.2, 11.6-cert9).

Title: Asterisk DB Dialplan Function Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:

A remote authenticated user can invoke the DB dialplan function to gain elevated privileges.

Gareth Palmer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.32.1,11.14.1, 12.7.1, 13.0.1; 1.8.28-cert3,11.6-cert8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-018.html

Title: Asterisk CONFBRIDGE Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary System Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function and the ConfbridgeStartRecord AMI action to execute arbitrary system commands on the target system.

Gareth Palmer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.14.1, 12.7.1, 13.0.1; 11.6-cert8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-017.html

Title: Asterisk PJSIP Channel Driver Flaw in res_pjsip_refer Module Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the res_pjsip_refer module in the processing of an INVITE with Replaces message and cause the module to hang.

Joshua Colp reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target PJSIP module to hang.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.7.1, 13.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-016.html

Title: Asterisk PJSIP Channel Driver Race Condition Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data to trigger a race condition in the queuing of SIP session actions and cause the target chan_pjsip channel driver to crash.

Yaron Nahum reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target channel driver to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.7.1, 13.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-015.html

Title: Asterisk ConfBridge State Transition Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When under load, an internal API used by the ConfBridge application may introduce delays to state transitions and cause the channel to hang.

Ben Klang reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions in the ConfBridge application.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.14.1; 11.6-cert8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-014.html

Title: Asterisk PJSIP ACL Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can bypass access controls.
The res_pjsip_acl module does not properly load and apply access control lists (ACLs) at startup. A remote user can bypass PJSIP ACLs.

Jonathan Rose reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access control lists.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.7.1, 13.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-013.html

Title: Asterisk IP Address Checking Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can bypass access controls.
In some cases, the system does not properly check address ranges in the IP-based access control lists (ACLs). If the source IP address for an incoming packet is not within the same address family for the first ACL entry, no further ACL rules are checked. A remote user may be able to bypass access controls.

The following components are affected:

All VoIP channel drivers                                 
DUNDi                                                    
Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI)

Andreas Steinmetz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.32.1, 11.14.1, 12.7.1, 13.0.1; 11.6-cert8, 1.8.28-cert3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-012.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Discloses Valid Usernames to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted URL requests to the target device to determine if a specified username account exists on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur63497 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8000

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Remote Mobile Access Subsystem Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can spoof the system.
A remote user can supply a Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate containing a specially crafted Subject Alternative Name (SAN) field that is signed by a certificate authority trusted by the Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM) to exploit a flaw in the Remote Mobile Access Subsystem and impersonate a valid Video Communication Server (VCS) device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq86376 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the system and masquerade as a valid Video Communication Server (VCS) device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7991

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in CCM Service Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The CCM Service interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90597 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3375

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Admin Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Admin interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90582 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3374

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in CCM Dialed Number Analyzer Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The CCM Dialed Number Analyzer interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup92550 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3373

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup88089 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3366

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Reports Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The CCM reports interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90589 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3372

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can decrypt SSL sessions in certain cases.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the SSL implementation.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur23720 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.openssl.org/~bodo/ssl-poodle.pdf

Bodo Moller, Thai Duong, and Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141015-poodle

Title: Asterisk SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can decrypt SSL sessions in certain cases.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the SSL implementation.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.openssl.org/~bodo/ssl-poodle.pdf

Bodo Moller, Thai Duong, and Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.31.1, 11.13.1, 12.6.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-011.html

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Emergency Responder) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Emergency Responder is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169 for Cisco Emergency Responder.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur05434 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaw Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected. The impact may vary.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager and Unified Communications Manager Session Management Edition.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur00930 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

Title: Asterisk res_fax_spandsp Module Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted out-of-call message to trigger a crash if the channel servicing the message is sent to the ReceiveFax dialplan application when using the res_fax_spandsp module.

The res_fax_digium module is not affected.

The vendor was notified on September 5, 2014.

Philippe Lindheimer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.12.1, 12.5.1; 11.6-cert6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2014-010.html

Title: Asterisk SIP SUBSCRIBE Type Handling Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SIP SUBSCRIBE request to cause the target service to crash.

A SIP SUBSCRIBE request with an unexpected mixes of headers for a given event package can trigger this flaw. The crash occurs in the PJSIP-based res_pjsip_pubsub module and not in the old chan_sip module.

The vendor was notified on September 18, 2014.

Mark Michelson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target SIP service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.5.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2014-009.html

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Communications Manager) Glibc Heap Overflow in __gconv_translit_find() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco Unified Communications Manager is affected.
A local user can set a specially crafted CHARSET environment variable value to trigger an off-by-one memory error and resulting heap overflow in __gconv_translit_find() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The local user may be able to cause a set user id (setuid) root application that uses this environment variable to execute code with root privileges.

A demonstration exploit method is described at:

http://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2014/08/the-poisoned-nul-byte-2014-edition.html

Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system, potentially with elevated privileges.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry for Cisco Unified Communications Manager.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuq65975 to this vulnerability for Cisco Unified Communications Manager.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-5119

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web framework code does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq68443 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3363

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Kerberos SSO Token Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Kerberos single sign-on (SSO) token data to exploit a flaw in the CTIManager module and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges.

Systems with the Cisco CTIManager enabled and configured for single sign-on are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95491 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3338

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP XML Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user on a registered endpoint can send specially crafted XML data via SIP to cause the target process to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtq76428 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3337

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager CLI Restriction Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Remain Undetected As a Logged in User
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can remain undetected as a logged in user.
A remote authenticated user can can exploit a flaw in the command line interface restrictions to remain undetected as a logged in user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup98029 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can remain undetected as a logged in user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3332

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Server Lets Remote Users Conduct SYN Flood Attacks to Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can conduct a TCP SYN flood attack against the Intercluster Sync Agent Service on to exceed the 'tcp max connections' parameter and cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun34125 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3328

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise Lets Remote Authenticated Users View Files in the Web Directory
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise. A remote authenticated user can view files in the web root directory.
A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL to exploit a directory traversal flaw in the web interface and view files in the web root directory.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun25262 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view files in the web root directory.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3323

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Upload, Delete, and Download Arbitrary Files
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can upload, delete, and download arbitrary files.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted parameter values to upload arbitrary files to a restricted location on the target system [CVE-2014-3316]. The vulnerability resides in the Multiple Analyzer of the Dialed Number Analyzer (DNA). The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup76297 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted URL requests to delete files from arbitrary locations on the target system [CVE-2014-3317]. The vulnerability resides in the Multiple Analyzer of the Dialed Number Analyzer (DNA). The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup76314 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted URL requests to view files from arbitrary locations on the target system [CVE-2014-3318]. The vulnerability resides in the '/dna/viewfilecontents.do' of the Dialed Number Analyzer (DNA). The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup76318 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted URL requests to view files from arbitrary locations on the target system [CVE-2014-3319]. The vulnerability resides in the Real-Time Monitoring Tool (RTMT). The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup57676 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can upload, delete, and download arbitrary files.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3316
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3317
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3318
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3319

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise) Struts Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify Server-Side Context Objects
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Struts. A remote user can modify server-side context objects. Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise is affected.
A remote user can bypass the '#'-usage protection built into the ParametersInterceptor function to manipulate server-side context objects.

Meder Kydyraliev, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify server-side context objects.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise (10.5(1)).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140709-struts2

Title: Asterisk PJSIP Channel Driver Thread Deadlock Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can terminate a subscription to cause the target Asterisk service to deadlock the thread that services SIP requests.

The vendor was notified on May 28, 2014.

Mark Michelson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-008.html

Title: Asterisk HTTP Connection Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Exhaust Available HTTP Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can open a TCP or TLS connection to the target HTTP or HTTPS port and then fail to send or complete an HTTP request to cause the HTTP session to hang. This can be repeated to consume all available HTTP sessions.

The vendor was notified on May 25, 2014.

Richard Mudgett reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available HTTP sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.15-cert6, 11.6-cert3, 1.8.28.1, 11.10.1, 12.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2014-007.html

Title: Asterisk MixMonitor Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Shell Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user with manager privileges can invoke the MixMonitor manager action to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target Asterisk process.

The vendor was notified on April 9, 2014.

Corey Farrell reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system with the privileges of the target Asterisk process.
Solution:

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, Opern Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can modify content and redirect users to arbitrary web sites.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-2114]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Emergency Responder software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun24384 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can take actions on the web interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-2115]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun24250 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can cause arbitrary content to be displayed on the target user's browser [CVE-2014-2116]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun37882 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the web interface cause the target user's web page to be redirected to an arbitrary web page [CVE-2014-2117]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun37909 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Emergency Responder software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can modify content and redirect users to arbitrary web sites.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2114
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2115
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2116
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2117

A remote user can send specially crafted requests to trigger a crash in the PJSIP channel driver.

Systems with the "qualify_frequency" configuration option enabled are affected.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted SIP INVITE requests to consume all available file descriptors.

Systems with the chan_sip configured with "session-timers" set to "originate" or "accept" are affected.

The vendor was notified on February 25, 2014.

Corey Farrell reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can consume all available file descriptors on the target system.

A remote user can send an HTTP request with specially crafted Cookie headers to trigger a stack overflow or consume all available memory.
