Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Modify System Data and Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can modify system information. A local user can read and write files on the target system. A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the OS Administration Call Detail Records (CDR) Analysis and Reporting (CAR) web interface acting as the target user [CVE-2014-0740].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun00701 to this vulnerability.

A local user can submit a specially crafted command line entry to exploit a flaw in the certificate import Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0741].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95461 to this vulnerability.

A local user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) command-line function for Certificate Signing Request (CSR) management to read or write arbitrary files to the underlying operating system [CVE-2014-0742].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95464 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) to modify information related to registered devices [CVE-2014-0743].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum95468 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

A remote user can modify information related to registered devices.

A local user can read and write files on the target system.

A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub54349 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5555

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Administrative Interface Lets Remote Authenticated Users View Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The administrative web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request containing directory traversal characters to view arbitrary files on target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui78815 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5528

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Enterprise License Manager Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The Enterprise License Manager (ELM) web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can take actions on the ELM interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui58210 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3472

Title: Asterisk SIP Request Processing Flaw With Invalid SDP Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP request with an invalid SDP to cause the target service to crash.

The vendor was notified on July 03, 2013.

Walter Doekes, OSSO B.V., reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.23.1, 10.12.3, 11.5.1; 1.8.15-cert3, 11.2-cert2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2013-005.html

Title: Asterisk SIP ACK With SDP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a SIP ACK with SDP that is received after the channel has been terminated to cause the target service to crash.

The vendor was notified on February 11, 2013.

Colin Cuthbertson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.23.1, 11.5.1; 1.8.15-cert3, 11.2-cert2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2013-004.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted registration messages to trigger an error handling flaw and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2013-3459].

Version 7.1(x) is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf93466 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send UDP packets at a high rate to certain ports to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2013-3460].

Versions 8.5(x), 8.6(x), and 9.0(x) are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub85597 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send UDP packets at a high rate to port 5060 to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2013-3461].

Versions 8.5(x), 8.6(x) and 9.0(1) are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub35869 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-3462].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud54358 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(2)).

Additional fixes are available for some prior versions and are listed in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130821-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a large number of TCP connections to ports 5060 or 5061 to trigger a memory leak and cause denial of service conditions.

A restart is required to return the system to normal operation. 

The vendor gas assigned bug ID CSCud84959 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt services. A restart is required to return the system to normal operation.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/mcontent/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130821-cup

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Discloses Stack Trace Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a stack exception on the web portal to view exception stack trace details.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug34854 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3442

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Web Page Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui13033 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3451

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager User Web Dialer Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The user web dialer does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui13028 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3450

Title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Input Validation Flaw Permits HTTP Header Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Operations Manager. A remote user can conduct HTTP header injection attacks.
The software does not properly validate URLs. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will be able to take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCud80182 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3439

Title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Operations Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The administrative web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCud80186 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3440

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Inject SQL Commands and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value via TCP ports 8080 or 8443 to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-3404]. This can be exploited to create arbitrary encrypted authentication credentials in the database that can be used to access the system. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh01051 to this vulnerability. Versions 9.1(1a) and prior are affected.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value via TCP ports 8080 or 8443 to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-3412]. This can be exploited to modify or insert additional data into certain database tables. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh81766 to this vulnerability. Versions 9.1(2) and prior are affected.

The system uses a hard-coded encryption key to encrypt sensitive data stored within the database and to secure computer telephony integration (CTI) communications. A user can exploit this to decrypt user credentials. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCsc69187 to this vulnerability. Versions 9.1(2) and prior are affected.

Cisco Unified Presence Server/IM and Presence Service versions 9.1(2) and prior are also use a hard-coded encryption key. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui01756 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of the database user [CVE-2013-3402]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh73440 to this vulnerability. Versions 9.1(2) and prior are affected.

A local user can exploit file permission, environment variable, and relative path flaws to modify system scripts and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-3403, CVE-2013-3433, CVE-2013-3434]. The vendor has assigned big IDs CSCuh73454, CSCuh87042, CSCui02242, and CSCui02276 to these vulnerabilities. Versions 9.1(1a) and prior are affected.

Emerging Defense, LLC, reported the SQL injection vulnerability. Lexfo reported the other vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
Cisco has released a Cisco Options Package (COP) file that addresses the following vulnerabilities: CSCuh01051 [CVE-2013-3404], CSCuh87042 [CVE-2013-3403] and CSCuh73454 [also CVE-2013-3403].

No solution was available for the other vulnerabilities at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130717-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Service Monitor Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Service Monitor. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Service Monitor software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh95997 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Service Monitor software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3416

Title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Operations Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh47574 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3416

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Authentication Request Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly throttle authentication requests. A remote user can send multiple authentication requests in a short period of time to cause performance degradation on the target application.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud39515 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause performance degradation on the target application.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1188

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Web Framework Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted TCP packets to trigger a memory allocation flaw and consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

A reboot is required to restore free memory.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCug38080 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1242

Title: Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users View and Overwrite Files, Deny Service, Execute Applications, and Gain Administrator Access
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal. A remote user can execute arbitrary applications on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can view and modify files on the target system. A remote user can gain administrator access.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP INVITE message to trigger a flaw in the the CallServer component and cause the system to not accept new calls [CVE-2013-1220].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCua65148 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Tomcat web application to gain administrator access [CVE-2013-1221].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub38384 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Tomcat web application to execute unauthorized user-supplied web applications [CVE-2013-1222].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub38379 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a parameter validation and file access flaw in the log viewer to view arbitrary system files [CVE-2013-1223].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub38372 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a parameter validation path traversal flaw in Resource Manager component to overwrite system files [CVE-2013-1224].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub38369 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit an XML entity expansion flaw to view arbitrary system files [CVE-2013-1225].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub38366 to this vulnerability.

Alex Senkevitch reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can gain administrator access.

A remote user can execute arbitrary web applications on the target system.

A remote user can cause the system to not accept new calls.

A remote user can view and overwrite system files.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.0.1 ES 11).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130508-cvp

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in CLI Lets Local Users Read Arbitrary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM). A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.
A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the command-line interface (CLI) to read the contents of arbitrary files on the target system.
Impact': A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1240

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Discloses Username Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
When configured with alwaysauthreject enabled, allowguest disabled, and autocreatepeer disabled, a remote user can issue INVITE, SUBSCRIBE, and REGISTER transactions to determine valid usernames on the target system.

The vendor was notified on January 20, 2013.

Walter Doekes, OSSO B.V., reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.20.2, 10.12.2, 11.2.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2013-003.html

Title: Asterisk HTTP POST Content-Length Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send HTTP POST requests with specially crafted Content-Length values to cause the target HTTP service to crash.

This vulnerability was introduced by the fix for CVE-2012-5976 issued in AST-2012-014 [Alert ID 1027931].

Christoph Hebeisen, TELUS Security Labs, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target web service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.20.2, 10.12.2, 11.2.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2013-002.html

Title: Asterisk Stack Overflow in Processing SIP Headers Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP header to trigger a stack overflow in 'res/res_format_attr_h264.c' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The vendor was notified on January 6, 2013.

Ulf Harnhammar reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.2.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2013-001.html

Title: Skype Click to Call Update Service Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The c2c_service.exe application directory is world writable. The application loads 'msi.dll' from that directory. A local user can cause the click to call update service (c2c_service.exe) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

The vendor was notified on January 7, 2013.

Oliver-Tobias Ripka reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix [in February 2013].

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) port on TCP port 5060 to increase CPU utilization.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCua89930 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130227-cups

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Resource Exhaustion Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to consume all available CPU resources [CVE-2013-1133].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtx43337 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit an authentication flaw in Intracluster communications between Location Bandwidth Managers (LBMs) to poison the LBM transaction records and consume all available bandwidth pools and deny calls [CVE-2013-1134].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub28920 to this vulnerability. Only version 9.0(x) is affected.
Impact':
A remote user can consume all available CPU resources.

A remote user can consume all available bandwidth pools and deny calls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6(4)BE3K, 8.6(2a)su2, 9.1(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130227-cucm

Title: Asterisk State Caching Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 1.8.x prior to 1.8.19.1, 10.x prior to 10.11.1, 11.x prior to 11.1.1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to consume excessive resources on the target system.

Systems configured to allow anonymous calls are affected.

The vendor was notified on July 26, 2012.

Russell Bryant reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.19.1, 10.11.1, 11.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-015.html

Title: Asterisk Stack Allocation Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 1.8.x prior to 1.8.19.1, 10.x prior to 10.11.1, 11.x prior to 11.1.1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data via TCP to trigger a stack overflow and cause the target service to crash.

A remote authenticated user can also exploit this via HTTP and XMPP.

The vendor was notified on November 7, 2012.

Walter Doekes reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.19.1, 10.11.1, 11.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-014.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) data to interrupt voice services.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtw66721 to this vulnerability.

Devices configured to process SIP messages are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause a critical service to fail and restart, interrupting voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1(5b)su5, 8.5(1)su4, 8.6(2a)su1, and 8.6(4) (BE3K-only release)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-cucm

Title: Cisco Unified Presence and Jabber Extensible Communications Platform Stream Header Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence and Jabber Extensible Communications Platform. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) stream header to cause the target Connection Manager process to crash and restart.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtu32832 to this vulnerability.

Jabber Extensible Communications Platform (XCP) is also affected, including JabberNow Appliances.
Impact': A remote user can cause the Connection Manager process to crash, dropping connections for existing clients and preventing new clients from connecting.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6(3)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120912-cupxcp

Title: Asterisk Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can bypass certain call access controls.
A remote authenticated IAX2 user can make a call using the credentials of a peer defined in a dynamic Asterisk Realtime Architecture (ARA) backend to bypass the ACL rules set for the peer.

The vendor was notified on July 27, 2012.

Alan Frisch reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can bypass certain call access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.15.1, 10.7.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-013.html

Title: Asterisk AMI Originate Action Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated user with 'originate' class authorization can perform actions that ostensibly require 'system' class authorization.

The vendor was notified on July 13, 2012.

Zubair Ashraf of IBM X-Force Research reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.15.1, 10.7.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-012.html

Title: Cisco Emergency Responder UDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Emergency Responder. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to the CERPT port to cause the target service to consume excessive CPU resources.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtx38369 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/cer/8_7/english/release/notes/CER0_BK_CEE780BD_00_cisco-emergency-responder-87-release_chapter_00.html

Title: Cisco IP Communicator Bug Lets Remote Users Modify the Certificate Trust List via Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IP Communicator. A remote user with the ability to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks can modify the Certificate Trust List.
Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtz01471 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks can modify the Certificate Trust List.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/cipc/8_5/english/release_notes/CIPC8x_RN.html

Title: Asterisk Voicemail Access Memory Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
Two remote authenticated users can manipulate a single voicemail account simultaneously to trigger a double free memory error or out-of-bounds array access error and the target service to crash.

Nicolas Bouliane, Avencall Security Labs, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.13.1, 10.5.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-011.html

Title: Asterisk RTP Port Release Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can respond to a re-invite with a provisional response and not send a final response to cause the remote system to fail to clear the RTP port. This can be exploited to consume all available RTP ports on the target system.

Steve Davies reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the connected target system to consume all available RTP ports.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.13.1, 10.5.2, C.3.7.5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-010.html

Title: Asterisk Bug in Skinny Channel Driver Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user with a valid SCCP ID can close a connection to the target Asterisk server when a station is in the 'Off Hook' call state to cause the target server to crash.

Christoph Hebeisen, TELUS Security Labs, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.5.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-009.html

Title: Asterisk Null Pointer Dereference in SCCP Channel Driver Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user with a valid SCCP ID can close a connection in certain cases to cause the target server to crash.

Christoph Hebeisen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.12.1, 10.4.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-008.html

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Channel Driver Invalid Pointer Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When an established call is placed on hold (without a suggested music-on-hold class name) and the 'mohinterpret' configuration is set to 'passthrough' at the call generation point, an invalid pointer bug may occur.

mgrobecker reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.12.1, 10.4.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-007.html

Title: Cisco IP Communicator SCCP Message Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IP Communicator. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can cause the software to send multiple on-hook and off-hook SCCP messages to the Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM).

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCti40315 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The vendor advisory does not indicate if the target of the denial of service is the CIC or the CUCM.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/cipc/8_5/english/release_notes/CIPC8x_RN.html

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCth33834 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause unspecified denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/cust_contact/contact_center/crs/express_8_5/release/guide/uccx851rn.pdf

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP UPDATE request to cause Asterisk to perform a connected line update with no associated channel and crash.

The vendor was notified on April 16, 2012.

Thomas Arimont reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause Asterisk to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.11.1, 10.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-006.html

Title: Asterisk Heap Overflow in Skinny Channel Driver Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted KEYPAD_BUTTON_MESSAGE event data to trigger a heap overflow in the Skinny Channel Driver and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Russell Bryant reported this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on March 26, 2012.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.2.24, 1.8.11.1, 10.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-005.html

Title: Asterisk Manager Interface Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Shell Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user on the Asterisk Manager interface can execute arbitrary shell commands.
A remote authenticated user on the Asterisk Manager interface can bypass a security check and execute shell commands.

The MixMonitor application with the originate action or either the GetVar or Status manager actions in combination with the SHELL and EVAL functions can be used to exploit this flaw.

The vendor was notified on February 23, 2011.

David Woolley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user on the Asterisk Manager interface can execute arbitrary shell commands.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.2.24, 1.8.11.1, 10.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-004.html

Title: Asterisk Stack Overflow in HTTP Manager Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP Digest Authentication data to trigger a stack overflow in the HTTP Manager interface and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Russell Bryant reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.10.1, 10.2.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-003.html

Title: Asterisk Milliwatt Application Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the Milliwatt Application. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.

Systems using the Milliwatt application are affected.

Russell Bryant reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.44, 1.6.2.23, 1.8.10.1, 10.2.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-002.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Inject SQL Commands
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Skinny Client Control Protocol (SCCP) message to the target device via TCP ports 2000 or 2443 to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-4486]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtu73538 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Skinny Client Control Protocol (SCCP) messages to the target device via TCP ports 2000 or 2443 to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the target device [CVE-2011-4487]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtu73538 to this vulnerability.

The following product versions are also affected by these vulnerabilities:

  * Cisco Business Edition 3000
  * Cisco Business Edition 5000
  * Cisco Business Edition 6000

Felix Lindner of Recurity Labs GmbH and Sandro Gauci reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1(5b)su5, 8.0(3a)su3, 8.6(2a) su1, Cisco Business Edition 3000 version 8.6.3 or 8.6(2a)su1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120229-cucm

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) Asterisk SRTP Video Support Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
If video support has not been enabled and the res_srtp Asterisk module is loaded on the target system, a remote user can attempt to negotiate a secure video stream to cause Asterisk to crash.

Catalin Sanda reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Asterisk service to crash.
Solution:
Gentoo has issued a fix.

The Gentoo advisory is available at:

http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-201202-06.xml

Title: Asterisk SRTP Video Support Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
If video support has not been enabled and the res_srtp Asterisk module is loaded on the target system, a remote user can attempt to negotiate a secure video stream to cause Asterisk to crash.

Catalin Sanda reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Asterisk service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.8.2, 10.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2012-001.html

Title: Asterisk Discloses Username Validity to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can determine SIP usernames.
When the general and user/peer NAT settings differ in responding to the request origination port or the response port listed in the Via header, a remote user can determine whether a SIP name is valid or not.

The vendor was notified on July 18, 2011.

Ben Williams reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid SIP usernames.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor documentation describes how to avoid the vulnerability.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-013.html

Title: Asterisk Null Pointer Dereference in 'automon' Feature Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted SIP requests to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the target service to crash.

Systems with the 'automon' feature enabled in 'features.conf' are affected. This is not a default setting.

The vendor was notified on November 2, 2011.

Kristijan Vrban reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.2.21, 1.8.7.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2011-014.html

Title: Skype Discloses IP Addresses to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype. A remote user can determine the IP address of a Skype user.
A remote user can initiate a Skype call to a target user to determine the target user's IP address and then terminate the call before the target user's Skype application has indicated an incoming call.

The remote user does not need to be on the target user's contact list.

Researchers at Polytechnic Institute of New York University and at Inria reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine the IP address of a Skype user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express) Cisco Unified Communications Manager Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can view files on the target system. Cisco Unified Contact Center Express is affected.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to obtain arbitrary files on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth09343 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.x is not affected.

Cisco Unified Contact Center Express and Cisco Unified IP Interactive Voice Response are also affected.

Felix "FX" Lindner of Recurity Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco Unified Contact Center Express.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20111026-uccx

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to obtain arbitrary files on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth09343 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.x is not affected.

Cisco Unified Contact Center Express and Cisco Unified IP Interactive Voice Response are also affected.

Felix "FX" Lindner of Recurity Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1(5)SU2, 7.1(5b)SU2, 8.0(3)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20111026-cucm

Title: Skype Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Denial of Service Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Skype. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Several parameters do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Skype software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target user's client to crash.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The original advisory (presented at HITBSecConf) is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=293

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) and Pim J.F. Campers (X4lt) of Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the Skype site or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Uninitialized Variable Access Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to cause the system to access an uninitialized variable and crash.

Ehsan Foroughi reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.7.1, 10.0.0-rc1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2011-012.html

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Lets Remote Users Deny Service via XML Entity Expansion Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted XML to consume excessive memory and CPU resources on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtq78106, CSCtq89842, and CSCtq88547 to this vulnerability.

Jabber Extensible Communications Platform (Jabber XCP) is also affected.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory and CPU on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.5(4)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-xcpcupsxml.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Interrupt Voice Services
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages to trigger a memory leak and cause voice services to be interrupted.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl86047 to this vulnerability.

Version 4.x is not affected.

Cisco IOS is also affected.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1(5b)su4, 8.5(1)su2, 8.6(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-cucm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Service Monitor Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Service Monitor. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets to TCP port 9002 to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtn42961 to this vulnerability.

AbdulAziz Hariri reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110914-cusm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Operations Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets to TCP port 9002 to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtn42961 to this vulnerability.

AbdulAziz Hariri reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110914-cusm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Open Query Interface Lets Remote Users Obtain Database Contents
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence. A remote user can obtain database contents.
A remote user can access an open query interface on TCP port 443 or 8443 to obtain contents of the underlying databases on the target system. This may include authentication credentials, configuration details, and other sensitive information.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto73833 to this vulnerability.

kxlzx reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain database contents, including authentication credentials.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110824-cucm-cups.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Open Query Interface Lets Remote Users Obtain Database Contents
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can obtain database contents.
A remote user can access an open query interface on TCP port 443 or 8443 to obtain contents of the underlying databases on the target system. This may include authentication credentials, configuration details, and other sensitive information.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCti81574, CSCto63060, and CSCto72183 to this vulnerability.

kxlzx reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain database contents, including authentication credentials.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110824-cucm-cups.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can open multiple connections to cause the Packet Capture Service to consume excessive memory on the target device [CVE-2011-2560]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtf97162 to this vulnerability. Only 4.x versions are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets to cause voice service to be interrupted [CVE-2011-2561]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc61990 to this vulnerability. Certain configurations of Media Termination Points (MTP) are affected. Versions 7.0(x) and later are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP INVITE messages to trigger a coredump [CVE-2011-2562]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCth43256 to this vulnerability. Versions 6.x and later are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted Service Advertisement Framework (SAF) packets via TCP to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-2563, CVE-2011-2564]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCth26669 and CSCth19417 to these vulnerabilities. Cisco Intercompany Media Engine is also affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can disrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1(5)SU3, 7.1(5b)SU4, 8.0(3a)SU2, 8.5(1)SU2, 8.6(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110824-cucm.shtml

Title: Skype Input Validation Flaw in 'mobile phone' Profile Entry Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the The "mobile phone" profile entry before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Skype software and will run in the security context of that application. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the application, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the application, or take actions on the application acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

"><iframe src='' onload=alert('mphone')>

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.noptrix.net/advisories/skype_xss.txt

Levent 'noptrix' Kayan reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Skype software, access data recently submitted by the target user, or take actions on the application acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Asterisk Discloses Username Validity to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can determine valid SIP usernames.
The system may respond differently to remote SIP requests from an invalid SIP user than it responds to a valid SIP user (as configured on the target system). This may occur even when the alwaysauthreject option is set in the configuration.

A remote user can exploit this to determine valid SIP usernames.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid SIP usernames.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Open Source 1.4.41.2, 1.6.2.18.2, 1.8.4.4; Business Edition C.3.7.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-011.html

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Channel Driver Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Open Source 1.4.41.1, 1.6.2.18.1, 1.8.4.3; Business Edition C.3.7.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-010.html

Title: Asterisk SIP Packet Contact Header Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet containing a Contact header with a missing left angle bracket (<) to cause Asterisk to access a null pointer and crash.

Paul Belanger reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause Asterisk to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.4.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-009.html

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Null Character Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet containing a null to cause Asterisk to modify unrelated memory structures and crash.

TCP/TLS connections are not affected.

Paul Belanger reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause Asterisk to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.2.18.1, 1.8.4.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-008.html

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Null Pointer Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Contact header on a valid connection to trigger a null pointer error and cause the target service to crash.

Jonathan Rose reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.8.4.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-007.html

Title: Cisco Unified Operations Manager Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Directory Traversal Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Operations Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can view files on the target system.
The Operations Manager interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2011-0959].  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtn61716 to this vulnerability.

The Common Services Device Center is also affected [CVE-2011-0962]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto12712 to this vulnerability.

The Common Services Framework Help Servlet is also affected [CVE-2011-0961]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto12704 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2011-0960]. The 'CCMs' parameter of PRTestCreation and the 'ccm' parameter of TelePresenceReportAction are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtn61716 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to the CiscoWorks Homepage to view portions of files on target system [CVE-2011-0966]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto35577 to this vulnerability.

Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:

http://[target]:1741/cwhp/auditLog.do?file=..\..\..\..\..\..\..\boot.ini

http://[target]:1741/cwhp/auditLog.do?file=..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Program Files\CSCOpx\MDC\Tomcat\webapps\triveni\WEB-INF\classes\schedule.properties

http://[target]:1741/cwhp/auditLog.do?file=..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Program Files\CSCOpx\lib\classpath\com\cisco\nm\cmf\dbservice2\DBServer.properties

http://[target]:1741/cwhp/auditLog.do?file=..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Program Files\CSCOpx\log\dbpwdChange.log

The vendor was notified on February 28, 2011.

Sense of Security Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Operations Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.6).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23085
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23086
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23088
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23087
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23089

Title: Skype for Mac Unspecified Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype for Mac. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted message to a Skype user to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The Windows and Linux clients are not affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.purehacking.com/blogs/gordon-maddern/skype-0day-vulnerabilitiy-discovered-by-pure-hacking

Pure Hacking reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1.0.922).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://blogs.skype.com/security/2011/05/security_vulnerability_in_mac.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service, Inject SQL Commands, and Upload Arbitrary Files
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands. A remote authenticated user can upload arbitrary files to the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP message via TCP or UDP ports 5060 or 5061 to cause the target service to fail, interrupting voice services [CVE-2011-1604]. This vulnerability has been assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCti42904. Versions prior to 8.5(1), 8.0(3a)su2, 7.1(5b)su3, and 6.1(5)su3 are affected.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP message via TCP or UDP ports 5060 or 5061 to cause the target service to fail, interrupting voice services [CVE-2011-1605]. This vulnerability has been assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCth39586. Versions prior to 8.5(1), 8.0(3), 7.1(5b)su2, and 6.1(5)su2 are affected.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP message via TCP or UDP ports 5060 or 5061 to cause the target service to fail, interrupting voice services [CVE-2011-1606]. This vulnerability has been assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtg62855. Versions prior to 8.5(1), 8.0(3), 7.1(5)su1, and 6.1(5)su2 are affected.

The software does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2011-1607].  A remote authenticated user with the ability to intercept a packet to the target device can cause an arbitrary file to be uploaded to the target system. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCti81603 to this vulnerability. Versions prior to 8.5(1), 8.0(3a)su1, 7.1(5b)su3, and 6.1(5)su3 are affected.

The software does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2011-1609].  A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtg85647 to this vulnerability. Versions prior to 8.5(1), 8.0(3), 7.1(5)su1, and 6.1(5)su2 are affected. Alberto Revelli of Cigital reported this vulnerability. Timothy Morgan of vSecurity and Sven Taute also reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.

The software does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2011-1610]. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtj42064 to this vulnerability. Versions prior to 8.5(1)su1, 8.0(3a)su2, 7.1(5)su4, and 6.1(5)su3 are affected. Alberto Revelli of Cigital reported this vulnerability. Timothy Morgan of vSecurity and Sven Taute also reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact':
A remote user can disrupt voice services.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote authenticated user can upload arbitrary files to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1(5)SU3, 7.1(5b)SU4, 8.0(3a)SU2, 8.5(1)SU1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110427-cucm.shtml

Title: Asterisk Manager Security Check Bypass Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can invoke the Asterisk Manager Interface and send the 'Async' header with the 'Application' header during an Originate action to bypass a security check and execute arbitrary shell commands.

Mark Murawski reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.40.1, 1.6.1.25, 1.6.2.17.3, 1.8.3.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-006.html

Title: Asterisk Lets Remote Users Exhaust All Available File Descriptors
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can open a large number of connections to cause Asterisk to consume all available file descriptors and stop processing new calls.

Systems that have the Asterisk Manager Interface, Skinny, SIP over TCP, or the built in HTTP server enabled are affected.

Tzafrir Cohen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop processing new calls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.40.1, 1.6.1.25, 1.6.2.17.3, 1.8.3.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-005.html

Title: Skype for Android Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype for Android. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The Skype application stores potentially sensitive information in sqlite3 databases with world readable permissions. An application on the device can access the Skype username, account balance, full name, date of birth, city/state/country, home phone, office phone, cell phone, email addresses, webpage address, bio, contact list, instant message logs, and other information.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.androidpolice.com/2011/04/14/exclusive-vulnerability-in-skype-for-android-is-exposing-your-name-phone-number-chat-logs-and-a-lot-more/

Justin Case reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://blogs.skype.com/security/2011/04/privacy_vulnerability_in_skype.html

Title: Asterisk TCP/TLS Server Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can rapidly opening and closing TCP connections via the ast_tcptls_* API to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause Asterisk to crash.

The vendor was notified on March 1, 2011.

Blake Cornell and Chris Maj reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause asterisk to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.1.23, 1.6.2.17.1, 1.8.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-004.html

Title: Asterisk Manager Interface Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user repeatedly connect to the manager interface, send invalid data, and close the connection to cause Asterisk to consume all available CPU and memory resources.

The vendor was notified on Marcy 1, 2011.

Blake Cornell reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available CPU and memory resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.1.23, 1.6.2.17.1, 1.8.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-003.html

Title: Asterisk UDPTL Array Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDPTL data to trigger an array overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Systems configured for T.38 pass through or termination are affected. 

Matthew Nicholson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.39.2, 1.6.1.22, 1.6.2.16.2, 1.8.2.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-002.html

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in SIP Channel Driver Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted caller ID data to trigger a stack overflow in ast_uri_encode() and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The URIENCODE dialplan function is also affected. In some versions of asterisk, the AGI dialplan application is also affected.

Matthew Nicholson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.38.1, 1.4.39.1, 1.6.1.21, 1.6.2.15.1, 1.6.2.16.1, 1.8.1.2, 1.8.2.1; Asterisk Business Edition C.3.6.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2011-001.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager setuid Binary Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command line arguments to a set user id (setuid) binary to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor was notified on August 21, 2010.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCti52041 and CSCti74930 to this vulnerability.

Knud Erik Hjgaard of nSense reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=21656

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Interrupt Voice Services
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP message to cause the target voice services to be interrupted.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCta31358 and CSCtf14987 to these vulnerabilities.

Version 4.x is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1(5)SU1, 7.1(5b)SU2, 8.0(3a)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-cucmsip.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Interrupt Voice Services
Version(s): 6.x prior to 6.1(5)SU1, 7.x prior to 7.1(5b)SU2, 8.x prior to 8.0(3a)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to interrupt voice services.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtd17310 and CSCtf66305 to these vulnerabilities.

Version 4.x is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1(5)SU1, 7.1(5b)SU2, 8.0(3a)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100825-cucm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Presence SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Disrupt Presence Services
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Presence.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to cause a critical process on the target system to fail, potentially disrupting presence services.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtd14474 and CSCtd39629 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can disrupt presence services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.0(7), 7.0(8))

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100825-cup.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users View Arbitrary Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to the bootstrap service on TCP port 6295 to view arbitrary files on the target system.
