Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx76165 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Customer Response Solution (CRS) versions 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x and Cisco Unified IP Interactive Voice Response (Cisco Unified IP IVR) versions 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x are also affected.
Impact': A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0(2)SR3, 7.0(1)SR2, 7.0(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100609-uccx.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express CTI Server Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the computer telephony integration (CTI) server on TCP port 42027 to cause the CTI server and the Cisco Unified CCX Node Manager to fail.  All active agents will be logged out.

The node manager and the CTI server will automatically restart.

The CTI server is only operating when the Integrated Call Distribution (ICD) license is enabled.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso89629 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Customer Response Solution (CRS) versions 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x are also affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the computer telephony integration (CTI) server and the Cisco Unified CCX Node Manager to fail and active agents to logout.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0(2)SR3, 6.0(1) SR1, 7.0(1)SR4, 7.0(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100609-uccx.shtml

Title: Skype URI Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Injection Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype.  A remote user can cause commands to be executed on the target user's client application.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URI that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke 'Skype.exe' and pass extra parameters to the command line.

This can be exploited via the 'Datapath' parameter to cause the target user's Skype application to connect to a remote SMB share and download configuration and security policy data to the target user's Skype application and upload the target user's Skype account information to the remote SMB share.

Paul Craig of Security-Assessment.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a URI that, when loaded by the target user, will execute commands on the target user's Skype client.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.2.0.1.55).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://share.skype.com/sites/garage/2010/03/10/ReleaseNotes_4.2.0.155.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP/SCCP/CTI Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SCCP packets to cause a critical service to crash, which may disrupt voice services [CVE-2010-0587, CVE-2010-0588].  A manual restart may be required to return voice services to normal operations.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtc38985 and CSCtc47823 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP messages to cause a critical service to crash, which may disrupt voice services [CVE-2010-0590, CVE-2010-0591].  A manual restart may be required to return voice services to normal operations.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtc37188 and CSCtc62362 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send a specially crafted message to the CTI Manager service [not a default service] on TCP port 2748 to cause the target service to crash, potentially interrupting CTI applications [CVE-2010-0592].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsu31800 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Sipera VIPER Lab reported one of these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.  A manual restart may be required to return voice services to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.3(2)SR2, 6.1(5), 7.1(3a)su1, 8.0(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100303-cucm.shtml

Title: Asterisk Access Control Parsing Error May Let Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user may be able to bypass access controls and gain access to the target system.
The system does not properly parse access control lists that contain the '/0' CIDR notation in 'permit=' and 'deny=' host access rules.  A remote user may be able to bypass these access controls.

The vendor was notified on February 24, 2010.

Mark Michelson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass host-based access controls in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.0.25, 1.6.1.17, 1.6.2.5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2010-003.html

Title: Asterisk Scripting Support Lets Remote Users Inject Data into Dialplans
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can inject arbitrary data into dialplans.
A remote user can supply specially crafted string that may be expanded by Asterisk and interpreted as data.  A remote user may be able to exploit this to modify dialplan data.

The Dial() application is affected.  Other applications that do not properly filter untrusted user-supplied data may also be affected.

Hans Petter Selasky reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can inject arbitrary data into dialplans.
Solution:
The vendor has issued an advisory to warn developers of the risk of failing to filter untrusted data.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2010-002.html

Title: Asterisk T.38 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted FaxMaxDatagram value in a T.38 protocol message via SIP to cause the target service to crash.

bklang and elsto at issues.asterisk.org reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause Asterisk to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.0.22, 1.6.1.14, 1.6.2.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2010-001.html

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center products.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtd05790 (Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise), CSCtd05790 (Cisco Unified Contact Center Express), CSCtd05755 (Cisco Unified Contact Center Management Portal), and CSCtd05790 (Cisco Unified Contact Center Products) to this vulnerability.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: Asterisk RTP Comfort Noise Payload Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted (but still valid) RTP comfort noise payload with a data length of 24 bytes or longer to cause the target service to crash.

amorsen at issues.asterisk.org reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.37, 1.4.27.1, 1.6.0.19, 1.6.1.11).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-010.html

Title: Asterisk Access Control Flaws Permit Cross-Site AJAX Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can conduct cross-site AJAX attacks.
The demonstration AJAX-based manager interface ('ajamdemo.html') includes the third party Prototype JavaScript framework ('prototype.js'), which contains a flaw that allows a remote user to issue an AJAX response from a different domain.

issues.asterisk.org user jcollie reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can conduct cross-site AJAX attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.26.3, 1.6.0.17, 1.6.1.9).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-009.html

Title: Asterisk Discloses Valid Usersnames to Remote Users in Response to Specially Crafted REGISTER Messages
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted REGISTER message twice to determine if the specified username exists on the target system.

The vendor was notified on October 26, 2009.

Patrik Karlsson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.35, 1.4.26.3, 1.6.0.17, 1.6.1.9).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-008.html

Title: Asterisk SIP INVITE ACL Can Be Bypassed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A prohibited remote user can make calls on a network.
The system fails to check SIP INVITE access control lists.  A remote device that should be denied per the 'sip.conf' file may be able to make calls on the target network.

Thomas Athineou reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A prohibited remote user can make calls on a network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.1.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-007.html

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Can Be Affected By TCP Flooding Attacks
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Presence.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can flood TCP ports 16200 or 22794 with completed connections to cause the target TimesTenD process to crash and restart [CVE-2009-2874].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy17662 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can establish many TCP connections to the target system to cause the internal connection tracking table to prevent new connections [CVE-2009-2052]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsw52371 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  This same vulnerability was previously reported in Alert ID 1022775 as affecting the Cisco Unified Communications Manager.]
Impact':
A remote user can cause the TimesTenD process to crash and restart.

A remote user can cause voice services to become unavailable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.0(6), 7.0(4)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091014-cup.shtml

Title: Skype Unspecified Flaw in Extras Manager Has Unspecified Impact
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype.  The impact was not specified.
The vulnerability resides in the Extras Manager.

No details were provided.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.1.0.179 for Windows).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://share.skype.com/sites/garage/2009/10/12/ReleaseNotes_4.1.x.179_hotfix_3.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target Cisco IOS device.
A remote user on a registered phone IP address can send specially crafted HTTP requests to trigger a buffer overflow in the login section of the Extension Mobility feature and execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq58779 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS devices configured for Cisco Unified CME and the Extension Mobility feature are affected.

Cisco IOS devices configured for Survivable Remote Site Telephony (SRST) Mode are not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco IOS XE is not affected.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-cme.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 5.x prior to 5.1(3g), 6.x prior to 6.1(4), 7.0.x prior to 7.0(2a)su1, 7.1.x prior to 7.1(2)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP messages to cause the main Cisco Unified Communications Manager process to reload. Voice services may be disrupted.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsz95423 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified CallManager versions 4.x are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the Cisco Unified Communications Manager process to reload, which may disrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1(3g), 6.1(4), 7.0(2a)su1, 7.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-cm.shtml

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Call Number Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can consume all available IAX2 call numbers to prevent additional calls from being accepted.

The vendor was notified on June 22, 2008.

Noam Rathaus and Blake Cornell separately reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent the target system from accepting calls.
Solution:
The vendor issued a fix (1.2.35, 1.4.26.2, 1.6.0.15, 1.6.1.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-006.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP and SCCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets to TCP or UDP ports 5060 or 5061 to cause the target service to crash [CVE-2009-2050, CVE-2009-2051].  Voice services will be disrupted.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi46466 to one of these vulnerabilities, where version 4.x is only affected if a SIP trunk is explicitly configured.  Versions prior to 6.1(1) are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsz40392 to the other vulnerability, which affects versions prior to 5.1(3g), 6.1(4), and 7.1(2).

A remote user can establish many TCP connections to the target system to cause the internal connection tracking table to prevent new connections [CVE-2009-2052].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq22534 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a flood of TCP packets to exhaust operating system file descriptors and cause the SCCP port (TCP ports 2000 and 2443) to close [CVE-2009-2053].  This may prevent new SCCP connections.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx32236 to this vulnerabiltiy.

A remote user can send a flood of TCP packets to exhaust operating system file descriptors and cause the SIP port (TCP ports 5060 and 5061) to close [CVE-2009-2054].  This may prevent new SIP connections.  The SIP UDP ports are not affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx23689 to this vulnerabiltiy.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Affected Cisco Unified Communications Manager services may require a manual restart to return to normal operations.
Impact': A remote user can cause voice services to become unavailable.  A manual restart may be required to return the services to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1(3g) [available early September 2009], 6.1(4), 7.1(2a)SU1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090826-cucm.shtml

Title: Asterisk Bug in Processing SIP Packets Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 1.6.1 prior to 1.6.1.4; previous releases also affected.
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets to cause the target service to consume all available stack memory for the SIP network thread and crash.

The flaw is only exploitable in version 1.6.1 and later.

Nick Baggott of Mu Dynamics reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.34, 1.4.26.1, 1.6.0.12, 1.6.1.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-005.html

Title: Asterisk RTP Frame Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted RTP text frames to cause the target service to crash.

The vendor was notified on July 27, 2009.

Marcus Hunger reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.6.1.2).

A patch for version 1.6.1 is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2009-004-1.6.1.diff.txt

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/security/AST-2009-004.html

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Express Administration Pages Permit Script Injection and Directory Traversal Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express.  A remote authenticated user can inject arbitrary scripting code.  A remote authenticated user can access files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can invoke the Customer Response Solutions (CRS) Administration interface to view, modify, or delete arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2009-2047].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsw76644 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can inject JavaScript into the Cisco Unified CCX database [CVE-2009-2048].  When the database is accessed by the target user, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the device in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsw76649 to this vulnerability.

The following product versions are affected:

* Cisco Customer Response Solution (CRS) versions 3.x, 4.x, 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x
* Cisco Unified IP Interactive Voice Response (Cisco Unified IP IVR) versions 3.x, 4.x, 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x
* Cisco Unified CCX 4.x, 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x
* Cisco Unified IP Contact Center Express versions 3.x, 5.x, 6.x, and 7.x
* Cisco Customer Response Applications versions 3.x
* Cisco IP Queue Manager (IP QM) versions 3.x

National Australia Bank's Security Assurance team reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can view, modify, and delete files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (CRS version 7.0(1)SR2).

Hotfixes crs5.0.2sr2es09 and crs6.0.1sr1es05 are also available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090715-uccx.shtml

Title: (Nortel Issues Fix for Nortel Media Procesing Server 1000) Adobe Acrobat Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges.  Nortel Media Processing Server 1000 is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger any of several flaws and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Multiple input validation errors allow code execution [CVE-2008-4812, CVE-2008-4813].

Input validation flaws in JavaScript methods allow code execution [CVE-2008-2992, CVE-2008-4814].

An input validation flaw in the Download Manager may allow code execution during the download process [CVE-2008-4817].

A flaw in the Windows-version of the Download Manager may allow the target user's Internet Security options to be modified during the download process [CVE-2008-4816].

A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on UNIX-based systems [CVE-2008-4815].

A user can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-2549].

Adobe Reader 9 and Acrobat 9 are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs, Peter Vreugdenhil via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative and via iDefense, Dyon Balding of Secunia Research, Will Dormann of CERT/CC, Damian Frizza of Core Security Technologies, Greg MacManus of iSIGHT Partners Labs, Javier Vicente Vallejo via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative, Thomas Garnier of SkyRecon Systems, and Josh Bressers of Red Hat reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Nortel has issued a fix (Adobe update 8.1.4, bundled into the Solaris patch and available with Nortel PERIdoc patch doc3.0.0.6) for Nortel Media Processing Server 1000, which is affected by these vulnerabilities [all except CVE-2008-4816].

The Nortel advisory is available at:

http://support.nortel.com/go/main.jsp?cscat=BLTNDETAIL&id=909609

Title: Asterisk SIP Responses Let Remote Users Determine Valid Usernames on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
A remote user can analyze responses from the target system to determine whether a specified SIP account exists on the system.

Kerin Millar and Fergal Glynn reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid SIP account names on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.32, 1.4.24.1, 1.6.0.8)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2009-003.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IP Phone Personal Address Book Synchronizer Sends Passwords in Clear Text
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user monitoring the network can obtain critical passwords.
The IP Phone Personal Address Book (PAB) Synchronizer feature sends certain passwords over the network in clear text.  A remote user monitoring the network can obtain the passwords and then use the passwords to gain complete administrative access to the target Cisco Unified Communications Manager system.

The Directory Manager and the TabSyncSysUser (axl user) passwords are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCso76587 and CSCso78528 to this vulnerability.

The following products are affected:

  * Cisco Unified CallManager 4.1 versions
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.2 versions prior to 4.2(3)SR4b
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.3 versions prior to 4.3(2)SR1b
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 5.x versions prior to 5.1(3e)
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 6.x versions prior to 6.1(3)
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 7.0 versions prior to 7.0(2)

Olivier Grosjeanne of Dimension Data France reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user monitoring the network can obtain critical passwords.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090311-cucmpab.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Certificate Authority Proxy Function Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
If the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) service is enabled [not the default configuration], a remote user can send specially crafted data to the target service to cause the interruption of voice services.

Version 7.0(1) is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq32032 to this vulnerability.

VoIPshield reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1(3e), 6.1(3)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090121-cucmcapf.shtml

Title: Asterisk Discloses Whether User Accounts Are Valid to Remote Users
Version(s): 1.2.x prior to 1.2.31, 1.4.x prior to 1.4.23-rc4, 1.6.x prior to 1.6.0.3-rc2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can determine valid user accounts on the target system.
The IAX2 service responds differently to valid and invalid authentication attempts.  A remote user can determine whether the specified user name exists on the target system or not.

The vendor was notified on October 15, 2008.

unprotectedhex.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid user accounts on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.31, 1.4.22.1, 1.6.0.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2009-001.html

Title: Asterisk Realtime Configuration API Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can cause the target service to crash by attempting to authenticate as an unknown user or attempting to authenticate using hostname matching.

Servers configured to support realtime IAX2 users are affected.

The vendor was notified on November 22, 2008.

Jon Leren Schopzinsky reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Asterisk Open Source 1.2.30.4; Asterisk Business Edition B.2.5.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-012.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 4.1 prior to 4.1.3SR8, 4.2 prior to 4.2(3)SR4b, 4.3 prior to 4.3(2)SR1a, 5.x prior to 5.1(3d), 6.x prior to 6.1(2)su1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a valid Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packet to cause the target device to reload, disrupting voice services.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager version 7.x is not affected.

Cisco Unified CallManager version 4.x is not affected if no SIP trunks are configured.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsu38644 and CSCsm46064 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload, disrupting voice services.
Solution:
Cisco plans to issue fixes in October and November 2008 (4.1(3)SR8, 4.2(3)SR4b, 4.3(2)SR1a, 5.1(3d), 6.1(2)SU1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-cucm.shtml

Title: Asterisk Firmware Update Protocol Lets Remote Users Attack Arbitrary Sites Via the Asterisk Server
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can initiate denial of service attacks via the target system.
A remote user can send a spoofed IAX2 PWDOWNL request to the target system to cause the target system to respond to the spoofed system. A 40 byte PWDOWNL request can result in a 1040 byte response.  This can be exploited by a remote user to attack arbitrary systems via the target system.

The vendor was notified on July 18, 2008.

Tilghman Lesher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can attack arbitrary systems via the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.2.30, 1.4.21.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-011.html

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Poke Packet Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted IAX2 POKE requests to consume all available IAX2 protocol call numbers on the target system, preventing other IAX2 calls from getting through.

The vendor was notified on July 18, 2008.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://downloads.securityfocus.com/vulnerabilities/exploits/30321.pl

Jeremy McNamara reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available IAX2 call numbers on the target system, preventing additional calls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.2.30, 1.4.21.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-010.html

Title: Avaya Communication Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Access Information and Utiliites and Let Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Avaya Communication Manager.  A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information and access certain utilities and applications.
A remote authenticated user on the Avaya SIP Enablement Service (SES) web administration interface can exploit flaws in the interface to execute code with root privileges.

A remote user can execute scripts from the objects folder and the states folder.

A remote user can execute a certain default application.

A remote user can access full system help.

A remote user can view application server configuration data.

A remote user can view the database server configuration.

A remote user can access a utility to decrypt subscriber and database passwords.

A remote user can access the certificate installation utility.

A remote authenticated user on the Avaya Communication Manager (CM) web administration interface can execute arbitrary system commands.

A remote authenticated user on the Avaya Messaging Storage Server (MSS) Messaging Administration interface can execute arbitrary system commands with 'vexvm' user privileges.

The original advisories are available at:

http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=76
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=77
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=78
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=79
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=80
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=81
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=82
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=83
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=84
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=85
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=86
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=87
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=88
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=89
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=90
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=91
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=92
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=93
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=94
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=95
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=96
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=97
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=98
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=99
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=100
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=101
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=102
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=103
http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=104

VoIPshield reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information and access certain utilities and applications.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

Title: Nortel SIP Multimedia PC Client Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Nortel SIP Multimedia PC Client.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The client does not limit the number of connections or active windows.  A remote user can create a large number of sessions to exhaust resources on the target client.

VoIPshield reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=61
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.  The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.nortel.com/go/main.jsp?cscat=BLTNDETAIL&id=738961

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Users Access Statistics
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can bypass authentication to access statistics.
A remote user can connect to the Real-Time Information Server (RIS) Data Collector service on TCP port 2556 to bypass authentication and gain access to CUCM cluster statistics.

For CUCM 4.x versions, Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq35151 to this vulnerability [CVE-2008-2062].  For CUCM 5.x and 6.x versions, Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj90843 to this vulnerability [CVE-2008-2730].

The following version are affected:

  * Cisco Unified CallManager 4.1 versions
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.2 versions prior to 4.2(3)SR4
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 4.3 versions prior to 4.3(2)SR1
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 5.x versions prior to 5.1(3c)
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 6.x versions prior to 6.1(2)

Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express is not affected.

VoIPshield reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access CUCM statistics.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (4.2(3)SR4, 4.3(2)SR1, 5.1(3), and 6.1(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080625-cucm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager CTI Manager Service Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can connect to the Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) Manager service on TCP port 2748 and send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions.

Cisco CUCM versions 5.x and 6.x are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso75027 to this vulnerability.

The following version are affected:

  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 5.x versions prior to 5.1(3c)
  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager 6.x versions prior to 6.1(2)

Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed version (5.1(3c) and 6.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080625-cucm.shtml

Title: Skype 'file://' URL Warning Can Be Bypassed By Remote USers
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype.  A remote user can bypass the 'file://' URL warning and potentially cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted 'file://' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will fail to warn the user before downloading and potentially executing the file.

The software does not properly check the case of file extensions and does not check for some file extensions associated with executable programs.

The vendor was notified on May 16, 2008.

Ismael Briones of Inkatel.com reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will download the file to the target user's system without warning.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.8.0.139).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.skype.com/security/skype-sb-2008-003.html

Title: Asterisk Pedantic Mode Bug in ast_uri_decode() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted From header value during pedantic mode processing to cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in the ast_uri_decode() function.

Hooi Ng reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.2.29), available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-008.html

Title: (Asterisk Issues Advisory) OpenSSL for Debian/Ubuntu Predictable RNG Lets Remote Users Determine Cryptographic Keys
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu Linux.  A remote user can determine keys.  Keys generated using Asterisk's 'astgenkey' script may be compromised.
The OpenSSL random number generator creates keys in a predictable manner.  A remote user can conduct guessing attacks to determine cryptographic keys.

Systems based on Debian Linux are affected, including Ubuntu Linux.

All cryptographic keys generated may be affected, including SSH keys, OpenVPN keys, DNSSEC keys, keys used in X.509 certificates, and session keys used in SSL/TLS connections.

GnuPG and GNUTLS keys are not affected.

Luciano Bello reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine keys.
Solution:
Asterisk issued an advisory warning that the Asterisk 'astgenkey' script uses OpenSSL to generate cryptographic keys.  Keys that were generated on Debian-based systems may be compromised and should be regenerated using a fixed version of Debian OpenSSL.

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-007.html

Title: Alcatel OmniPCX Input Validation Flaw in 'FastJSData.cgi' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Alcatel OmniPCX.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
The '/cgi-data/FastJSData.cgi' script does not properly validate user-supplied data in the 'id2' parameter.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted value to execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the web service.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/cgi-data/FastJSData.cgi?id1=sh2kerr&id2=91|cat%20/etc/passwd

The vendor was notified on January 8, 2008.

Digital Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.

OXO210: upgrade to release 210/091.001

OXO310: upgrade to release 310/056.001

OXO410: upgrade to release 410/057.001

OXO510: upgrade to release 510/037.001

OXO600: upgrade to release 610/014.001

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www1.alcatel-lucent.com/psirt/statements/2008001/OXOrexec.htm

Title: Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal Lets Remote Authenticated Administrative Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 4.0.x prior to 4.0(2)_ES14, 4.1.x prior to 4.1(1)_ES11, and 7.x prior to 7.0(1)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Customer Voice Portal.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated user with 'administrator' privileges can create, modify, or delete a superuser account.

Release 3.x is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj93874 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user with 'administrator' privileges can obtain 'superuser' privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0(2)_ES14, 4.1(1)_ES11, and 7.0(1) or later).

Version 4.0(2)_ES14 is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/36833091037661f49ad8152368c22bbf

Version 4.1(1)_ES11 is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/946b57654c80187da8c3cfc0aa02866e

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080521-cvp.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Services Can Be Interrupted By Remote Users
Description:
Some vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Presence.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1158, CVE-2008-1740].  Versions prior to 6.0(1) are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsh50164 and CSCsh20972 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can conduct a TCP port scan to trigger a flaw in the SIP Proxy service and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1741].  Versions 6.0(1) and 6.0(2) are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj64533 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt presence services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (6.0(3)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080514-cup.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Bugs in CTL CAPF, SIP, and SNMP Services Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.  The Certificate Trust List (CTL) Provider, Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF), Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), and Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Trap services are affected.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted TCP packets to the CTL service on TCP port 2444 to cause excessive memory consumption [CVE-2008-1742].  Version 5.x is affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj80609 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted TCP packets to the CTL service on TCP port 2444 to trigger a separate flaw and cause excessive memory consumption [CVE-2008-1743].  Versions 5.x and 6.x are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi98433 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 3804 to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1744].  Versions 4.1, 4.2, and 4.3 are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk46770 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP JOIN message to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1745].  Versions 5.x and 6.x are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi48115 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted UDP packets to the SNMP trap agent on UDP port 61441 to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1746].  Versions 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 5.x, and 6.x are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj24113 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP INVITE messages to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1747].  Versions 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 5.x, and 6.x are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk46944 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP INVITE messages to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2008-1748].  Versions 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 5.x, and 6.x are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsl22355 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can interrupt voice services.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (4.1.3SR7, 4.2(3)SR4, 4.3(2), 5.1(3), 6.1(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080514-cucmdos.shtml

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Protocol Verification Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a spoofed ACK response message to cause the target system to send audio connection packets to an arbitrary system, potentially causing denial of service conditions on the arbitrary system.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.altsci.com/concepts/page.php?s=asteri&p=2

Joel R. Voss (aka Javantea) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on a target system via an intermediate system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (1.2.28, 1.4.19.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-006.html

Title: Asterisk Predictable Session IDs May Let Remote Users Hijack HTTP Manager Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user may be able to hijack HTTP Manager sessions.
Manager session IDs are calculated in a manner that greatly reduces the number of guesses a remote user must make to predict the ID numbers.

The vendor was notified on February 25, 2008.

Dino A. Dai Zovi reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to hijack a web management session.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.19-rc3, 1.6.0-beta6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-005.html

Title: Asterisk Format String Bug in Logger and Manager Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the Logger and Manager functions.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The ast_verbose logging API call does not properly display data.  A remote user can provide a format string value so that when the Manager 'command' command is invoked by a target user, the application will crash.

The vendor was notified on March 13, 2008.

Steve Davies and Brandon Kruse reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the application to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.6.0-beta6), available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Lets Remote Users Make Unauthenticated Calls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can make phone calls without authenticating.
A remote user can set a specially crafted 'From' header to make unauthenticated calls via the SIP channel driver.

The vendor was notified on March 12, 2008.

Jason Parker from Digium reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can make phone calls without authenticating.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.27, 1.4.18.1, 1.4.19-rc3), available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-003.html

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in Processing RTP Codec Payload Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the processing of RTP payloads.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RTP payload number or send more than 32 RTP payloads to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The vendor was notified on March 11, 2008.

Mu Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.18.1, 1.4.19-rc3, and 1.6.0-beta6), available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-002.html

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Version(s): 5.0/5.1 versions prior to 5.1(3a), 6.0/6.1 versions prior to 6.1(1a)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The admin and user interface pages do not properly validate user-supplied input in the key parameter.  A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

This can be exploited to obtain information such as usernames, password hashes, and call records from the database.

Cisco CallManager or Unified Communication Manager systems prior to 5.0 are not affected.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCsk64286 to this vulnerability.

Nico Leidecker and Tracey Parry at Portcullis Computer Security Limited reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.portcullis.co.uk/267.php
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1(3a), 6.1(1a)).

Version 5.1 - Fixed Release 5.1(3a):

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/callmgr-51?psrtdcat20e2

Version 6.1 - Fixed Release 6.1(1a):

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/callmgr-61?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080213-cucmsql.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Buffer Overflow in Certificate Trust List Provider Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 4.0, 4.1 prior to 4.1(3) SR5c, 4.2 prior to 4.2(3) SR3, and 4.3 prior to 4.3(1) SR1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the Certificate Trust List Provider service on TCP port 2444 and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Versions 3.3, 5.0, 5.1, 6.0, and 6.1 are not affected.  Cisco CallManager Express is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj22605 to this vulnerability.

TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has released fixed versions: 4.1(3) SR5c, 4.2(3) SR3, 4.3(1) SR1.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080116-cucmctl.shtml

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Can Be Crashed By Remote Users With 'BYE with Also' Method
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BYE message using the 'BYE with Also' transfer method to trigger a NULL pointer error cause the target service to crash.

The vendor was notified on December 26, 2007.

Grey VoIP reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.17).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2008-001.html

Title: Asterisk Lets Remote Users Bypass Host-based Access Controls in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can bypass access controls in certain cases.
When a "realtime" database-based registration is processed and the username is correct and there is no password, the system does not check the IP address.  A remote user can impersonate arbitrary users that rely on host-based authentication without a password.

Both the SIP and IAX protocols are affected.

The vendor was notified on October 30, 2007.

Tilghman Lesher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.16).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2007-027.html

Title: Skype Memory Corruption Error in 'skype4com' URI Handler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the 'skype4com' URI handler and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vendor was notified on November 2, 2007.

TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-07-070.html
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.6), available as of November 15, 2007.

No vendor advisory had been posted at the time of this entry.

Title: Asterisk Input Validation Flaw in res_config_pgsql Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The res_config_pgsql module does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote user can supply specially crafted lookup data to execute SQL commands on the underlying administrative database, which contains usernames and passwords.

The vendor was notified on November 29, 2007.

P. Chisteas reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.15).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/node/48433

Title: Asterisk Input Validation Flaw in cdr_pgsql Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The cdr_pgsql module does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote user can supply a specially crafted ANI or DNIS parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying administrative database, which contains usernames and passwords.

The vendor was notified on November 29, 2007.

Tilghman Lesher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.15).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/node/48432

Title: Alcatel OmniPCX Enterprise Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Intercept Audio
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Alcatel OmniPCX.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions and potentially intercept audio connections.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TFTP request containing the MAC address of the target phone to the Communication Server to cause the audio from subsequent incoming calls to be sent to the remote user's system.

The target phone can still dial and receive calls, but without any ring tone and audio feedback.

The target phone must be rebooted to return to normal operations.

The vendor was notified on June 5, 2007.

Daniel Stirnimann reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.csnc.ch/static/advisory/secadvisorylist.html
Impact': A remote user can prevent normal operations and potentially intercept audio connections.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following patches:

OmniPCX  Enterprise R7.1: install patch F5.401.21.e
OmniPCX  Enterprise R7.0: upgrade to release R7.1
OmniPCX  Enterprise R6.2: install patch F3.301.38.a
OmniPCX  Enterprise R6.1: install patch F2.502.33
OmniPCX  Enterprise R6.0 and earlier: those releases are phased out: upgrade to release R7.1.

The Alcatel advisory is available at:

http://www1.alcatel-lucent.com/psirt/statements/2007004/IPTouchDOS.htm

Title: [Vendor Disputes Security Impact] Zaptel Buffer Overflow in 'sethdlc.c' May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Zaptel.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  [Editor's note:  The vendor has disputed the privilege escalation claim.]
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'sethdlc.c' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges on some systems.

Michael Bucko reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The vendor notes that the sethdlc application requires root privileges to access, so no privilege escalation is possible and, therefore, this is not a vulnerability.]
Impact': A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor plans to include a fix in an upcoming version (1.2.22, 1.4.7)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/asa/AST-2007-024.html

[Editor's note:  The vendor indicates that while a buffer overflow exists, the application containing the overflow requires root level access to trigger the overflow.]

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Grants Access to Certain Users to Read Web View Report Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center and Intelligent Contact Management products.  A remote user can gain access to certain web-based information.
A remote authenticated user listed in a Windows Active Directory domain can obtain access to certain functions on the target web interface.  The user can view Web View report information for arbitrary call center instances.

The following products are affected:

  * Cisco Unified Intelligent Contact Management Enterprise (Unified ICME)
  * Cisco Unified ICM Hosted (Unified ICMH)
  * Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise (UCCE)
  * Cisco Unified Contact Center Hosted (UCCH)
  * Cisco System Unified Contact Center Enterprise (SUCCE)

On the Cisco SUCCE, the remote authenticated user can gain access to the Web Admin tool to modify the application configuration

Cisco has assigend Cisco Bug ID CSCsj55686 to this vulnerability. 

Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to certain functions on the target web interface.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch (ICM7.1(5)_ES46).  The fix will be included in Maintenance Release 7.2(3) in December 2007.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071017-IPCC.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP INVITE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service and TFTP Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a flood of SIP INVITE messages to UDP port 5060 to consume all available resources and trigger a kernel panic on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsi75822 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified CallManager versions 3.x, 4.0 and 4.1, Communications Manager 4.2 and 4.3, and Cisco CallManager Express are not affected.

A remote user can send a specially crafted filename to trigger a buffer overflow in the TFTP service and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The vulnerability can also be triggered via the Centralized TFTP File Locator Service (via HTTP) on TCP port 6970.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh47712 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (5.1(2), 5.1(2b), 6.0(1)), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/callmgr-51?psrtdcat20e2

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20071017-cucm.shtml

Title: Asterisk-Addons Input Validation Flaw in cdr_addon_mysql Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk-Addons.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The cdr_addon_mysql module does not properly validate user-supplied input in the source and destination numbers within a call.  A remote user can supply a specially crafted destination number to an Asterisk system that is running the affected module to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

Humberto Abdelnur reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (Asterisk-Addons 1.2.8 and 1.4.4).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2007-023.html

Title: Asterisk IMAP Voicemail Buffer Overflows Let Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Asterisk.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A local user with write access to the 'asterisk.conf' file can set specially crafted values for the astspooldir parameter in 'asterisk.conf', the voicemail context, and voicemail mailbox to trigger a buffer overflow when a message is played or forwarded.

A remote user can set a specially crafted Content-type or Content-description header on an e-mail containing a voicemail message to trigger a buffer overflow when the message is played via a telephone.  Voicemail messages received via e-mail are not affected.

Systems using IMAP storage are affected by these vulnerabilities.

Russell Bryant and Mark Michelson reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.13).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/security/AST-2007-022.html

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix for PWLib) Ekiga SIPURL::GetHostAddress() Memory Corruption Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ekiga (GnomeMeeting).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  PWLib is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP URL to cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in the SIPURL::GetHostAddress() function.

The vendor was notified on July 9, 2007.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.s21sec.com/avisos/s21sec-036-en.txt

Jose Miguel Esparza of S21Sec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix for PWLib.

The Red Hat advisory is available at:

https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2007-0932.html

Title: Ekiga SIPURL::GetHostAddress() Memory Corruption Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ekiga (GnomeMeeting).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP URL to cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in the SIPURL::GetHostAddress() function.

The vendor was notified on July 9, 2007.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.s21sec.com/avisos/s21sec-036-en.txt

Jose Miguel Esparza of S21Sec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution: The report indicates that version 2.0.7 is not affected.

Title: Cisco CallManager/Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager/Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The admin and user logon pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'lang' parameter.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi64265 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can also create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Cisco CallManager software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi10728 to this vulnerability.

Gama SEC and Elliot Kendall from Brandeis University separately reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco CallManager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (3.3(5)sr2b, 4.1(3)sr5, 4.2(3)sr2, and 4.3(1)sr1).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070829-ccm.shtml

Title: Asterisk IMAP Voicemail Storage Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When Asterisk uses IMAP as the backend storage for voicemail, a remote user can send an e-mail message with a specially crafted MIME body.  When the target user listens to their voicemail using the phone, Asterisk will crash.

Other voicemail storage options are not affected.  Checking of voicemail via e-mail is also not affected.

Kevin Stewart reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause Asterisk to crash.
Solution:
A patch is available at:

http://lists.digium.com/pipermail/asterisk-commits/2007-August/015743.html

The vendor plans to issue a fix in the upcoming 1.4.12 release.

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/asa/AST-2007-021.html

Title: eCentrex Web Phone Buffer Overflow in 'uacomx.ocx' ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in eCentrex Web Phone.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the 'uacomx.ocx' ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Version 2.0.1 of the control is affected.

The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: BD80D375-5439-4D80-B128-DDA5FDC3AE6C

rgod reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/4299
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Asterisk SIP Dialog History Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The software records SIP dialog history regardless of whether SIP dialog history recording is enabled or not.

A remote user can create a SIP dialog with a large number of entries to consume all available system memory.

The vendor was notified on August 9, 2007.

Jon Moldenauer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available system memory.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.11).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/node/48377

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communiciations Manager.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to cause the target application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi80102 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability during internal testing.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (5.1(2b) and 6.0(1a)).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070808-IOS-voice.shtml

Title: Asterisk chan_skinny Driver Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the Skinny channel driver.  A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted CAPABILITIES_RES_MESSAGE packet to cause the target service to crash.  A packet with a capabilities count that is greater than the total number of items in the capabilities_res_message array can trigger the crash.

Wei Wang of McAfee AVERT Labs discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.10).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://downloads.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-019.pdf

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Channel Driver Resource Consumption Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When configured to allow unauthenticated calls, a remote user can send a flood of NEW packets to initiate calls and cause the system to allocate resources and never deallocate them.  This can cause a system to become unusable within a few seconds.

A restart is required to return to normal operations.

If the guest account or any other account that does not have a password is enabled, the system may be affected.

Russell Bryant reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to become unusable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions for the various editions of Asterisk.

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-018.pdf

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified Presence) Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) SSL/TLS Handshake Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco Unified Presence is affected.
JSSE does not properly process SSL/TLS handshake requests.  A remote user can send a specially crafted request to cause the target system to crash.

Sun credits Cisco Systems with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix (6.0(1)) for Cisco Unified Presence, which is affected by this Java vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070725-jsse.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified Call Manager) Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) SSL/TLS Handshake Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco Unified Call Manager is affected.
JSSE does not properly process SSL/TLS handshake requests.  A remote user can send a specially crafted request to cause the target system to crash.

Sun credits Cisco Systems with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix (5.1(2) and 6.0(1)) for Cisco Unified Call Manager, which is affected by this Java vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070725-jsse.shtml

Title: Asterisk STUN, Skinny Channel Driver, and IAX2 Channel Driver Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RTP frame to trigger a stack overflow in the IAX2 channel driver and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3762].  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Russell Bryant of Digium, Inc. discovered this vulnerability on July 12, 2007.

A remote user can send a specially crafted LAGRQ or LAGRP frame to trigger a crash in the target service [CVE-2007-3763].

The vendor was notified on July 13, 2007.  Chris Clark and Zane Lackey of iSEC Partners reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted packet where the declared packet data length is between 0 and 3 but the actual length is 4 or more bytes larger to trigger a large memcpy in the Skinny channel driver and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2007-3764].  The vendor notes that the impact of this vulnerability has not been investigated.

The vendor was notified on July 13, 2007.  Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted STUN packet via RTP to trigger a crash  [CVE-2007-3765].

The vendor was notified on July 13, 2007.  Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions for the various editions of Asterisk.

The Asterisk advisories are available at:

http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-014.pdf
 http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-015.pdf
http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-016.pdf
http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asa/ASA-2007-017.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Heap Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the Certificate Trust List (CTL) Provider service and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi03042 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger a heap overflow in the Real-Time Information Server (RIS) Data Collector service and execute arbitrary code.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi10509 to this vulnerability.

Version 6.0 is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Cisco credits IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force with reporting these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070711-cucm.shtml

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Sensitive Information
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can activate and terminate system services in a cluster environment, causing denial of service conditions for voice services.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsj09859 and CSCsj19985 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can view SNMP settings, including SNMP community strings.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsj20668 and CSCsj25962 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified Presence Server is also affected.

Cisco discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can activate and terminate voice services.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070711-voip.shtml

Title: Asterisk Stack Overflows in 'chan_sip.c' Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted T38FaxRateManagement or T38FaxUdpEC SDP values to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

This can be exploited if T38 fax via SIP is enabled in 'sip.conf'.

The vendor was notified on March 22, 2007.

Barrie Dempster of NGSSoftware Insight Security Research discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.3).

Title: Nortel Meridian CS 1000 Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Nortel Meridian CS 1000.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target media card to crash.
