A reboot is required to return the system to normal operation.

The vendor credits Eldon Sprickerhoff and Richard Gowman of eSentire with reporting this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  eSentire reported a denial of service vulnerability at CanSecWest 2007:  http://www.esentire.com/user_files/images/File/Presentations/UNIStimpy.pdf]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch (MPLR 23899).

The Nortel advisory is available at:

http://www130.nortelnetworks.com/go/main.jsp?cscat=BLTNDETAIL&DocumentOID=584936&RenditionID=&poid=null

Title: Cisco CallManager Input Validation Hole in Search Form Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the search form before displaying the input.  A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Cisco CallManager software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/CCMAdmin/serverlist.asp?findBy=servername&match=begins&pattern=<img%20src='http://www.scip.ch/scip.gif'%20style='border:%201px%20solid%20black;'>

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi12374 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on March 13, 2007.

Marc Ruef and Stefan Friedli discovered these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.scip.ch/cgi-bin/smss/showadvf.pl?id=2977
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco CallManager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version (4.2(3)sr2).

Cisco also plans to include the fix in the following future releases: 3.3(5)sr3, 4.1(3)sr5, and 4.3(1)sr1.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070523-ccm.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Unified CallManager) RSA BSAFE ASN.1 Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in RSA BSAFE.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco Unified CallManager is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted ASN.1 encoded data to trigger a parsing flaw and cause the linked application to crash.

The RSA BSAFE Crypto-C and Cert-C libraries (and applications that link to these libraries) are affected.

RSA has assigned Bug ID 46337 to this vulnerability.

US-CERT reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/754281
Impact': A remote user can cause the target application or device to crash.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix for Cisco Unified CallManager, which is affected by this RSA BSAFE vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070522-crypto.shtml

Title: Asterisk Manager Interface NULL Pointer Dereference Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the Manager Interface.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target Manager Interface to crash in certain situations.  If a manager user account is configured in the 'manager.conf' file without a password and then a subsequent connection attempts to invoke that username and MD5 authentication, a NULL pointer dereference will occur and the service will crash.

The manager interface is not enabled by default.

Asterisk Business Edition, AsteriskNOW, and the Asterisk Appliance Developer Kit is affected.

The vendor was notified on April 24, 2007.

Digium Technical Support reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the Manager Interface to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (1.2.18 and 1.4.3), available at:

ftp://ftp.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/files/ASA-2007-012.pdf

Title: Asterisk SIP Error Response Handling Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP response codes to cause the target service to crash.  All active calls and other sessions will be lost.

The vendor was notified on March 20, 2007.

Mantis reported this vulnerability to the vendor.

Asterisk Business Edition, AsteriskNOW, and the Asterisk Appliance Developer Kit is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Asterisk service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (1.2.18 and 1.4.3), available at:

ftp://ftp.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/files/ASA-2007-011.pdf

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in SIP/SDP T.38 Support Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted T38FaxRateManagement and T38FaxUdpEC SDP parameters to trigger one of two stack overflows in the T.38 SDP parsing code and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

T.38 support is not enabled by default.

AsteriskNOW and the Asterisk Appliance Developer Kit are affected.

The vendor was notified on March 22, 2007.

Barrie Dempster of NGS Software discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.3), available at:

ftp://ftp.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk 

For AsteriskNOW, the fix is included in Beta 6.

For the Asterisk Appliance, the fix is included in version 0.4.0.

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/files/ASA-2007-010.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified CallManager SCCP, SCCPS, ICMP, and IPSec Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified CallManager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets to the SCCP port (2000) and SCCPS port (2443) to cause the target CallManager to crash.  This will adversely affect voice services.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf10805 to this SCCP/SCCPS vulnerability.

A remote user can send a large amount of ICMP Echo Requests to the target CallManager or Cisco Unified Presence Server to cause various services to crash.  This will adversely affect voice services.

CallManager versions 3.x and 4.x are not affected by this ICMP vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsf12698 and CSCsg60930 to this ICMP vulnerability for the CallManager and Presence Server, respectively.

A remote user can a specially crafted UDP packet to the IPSec Manager service on UDP port 8500 to cause the service to fail.  This will adversely affect advanced call features and the ability to deploy configuration changes.  Standard call operations are not affected.

CallManager versions 3.x and 4.x are not affected by this IPSec Manager vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg20143 and CSCsg60949 to this IPSec Manager vulnerability for the CallManager and Presence Server, respectively.

The SCCP vulnerability was reported to Cisco by a Cisco customer.  The ICMP Echo Request and IPSec Manager Service vulnerabilities were discovered by Cisco.
Impact': A remote user can cause voice call processing or advanced call features to fail.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions of the CallManager:  3.3(5)SR2a, 4.1(3)SR4, 4.2(3)SR1, 5.0(4a)SU1

The vendor has also issued a fix for Cisco Unified Presence Server: 1.0(3)

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070328-voip.shtml

Title: Asterisk Can Be Crashed By Remote Users With an Unexpected SIP Response Code
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote system can send a specially crafted SIP packet (SIP Response code 0) to cause the target service to crash.

qwerty1979 reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.2).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://www.sineapps.com/news.php?rssid=1707

Title: Asterisk Error in Processing INVITE Messages Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP INVITE message to cause the target service to crash.  An anonymous INVITE message where the SDP contains two connection headers, one that is valid and one with an invalid IP address, can trigger the crash.  If anonymous calls are not permitted, then a valid username and password is required.

Humberto J. Abdelnur, Radu State, and Olivier Festor of the Madynes research team at INRIA Lorraine discovered this vulnerability using the Madynes VoIP fuzzer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.2 and 1.2.17).

Title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the asterisk SIP channel driver cause the denial of service conditions.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.4.1).

The Asterisk advisory is available at:

http://asterisk.org/node/48320

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix for GnomeMeeting) Ekiga Format String Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ekiga (formerly GnomeMeeting).  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the user running Ekiga.

The format string flaws reside in 'urlhandler.cpp', 'manager.cpp', and 'sip.cpp'.

Mu Security Team discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://labs.musecurity.com/advisories/MU-200702-01.txt
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix for GnomeMeeting.

The Red Hat advisory is available at:

https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2007-0086.html

Title: Ekiga Format String Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ekiga (formerly GnomeMeeting).  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the user running Ekiga.

The format string flaws reside in 'urlhandler.cpp', 'manager.cpp', and 'sip.cpp'.

Mu Security Team discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://labs.musecurity.com/advisories/MU-200702-01.txt
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (2.0.5), available at:

http://www.gnomemeeting.org/index.php?rub=5

Title: Cisco Unified Contact Center JTapi Gateway Can Be Restarted By Remote Users
Version(s): prior to ICM5.0(0)_SR13_ES18, ICM6.0(0)_SR8_ES3, ICM7.0(0)_SR4_ES43, and ICM7.1(3)_ES5
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center in the JTapi Gateway.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the JTapi server port to cause the target JTapi Gateway service to restart.  No new connections are processed while the gateway is restarting, which may take up to several minutes.  Existing connections are not affected.

Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise, Cisco Unified Contact Center Hosted, Cisco IP Contact Center Enterprise, and Cisco IP Contact Center Hosted product versions are affected.

Cisco Unified Contact Center Express and Cisco IP Contact Center Express are not affected.

Cisco Unified Intelligent Contact Management Enterprise and Hosted are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh15483 to this vulnerability.

This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by a Cisco customer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the JTapi Gateway process to restart.  No new connections are processed until the gateway is restarted.  Existing connections are not affected.
Solution:
Cisco has issued the following patches:

5.0:  ICM5.0(0)_SR13_ES18
6.0:  ICM6.0(0)_SR8_ES3
7.0:  ICM7.0(0)_SR4_ES43
7.1:  ICM7.1(3)_ES5

Cisco plans to issue maintenance release 7.1(4) in March 2007 and 6.0SR10 in April 2007.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070110-jtapi.shtml

Title: Asterisk Has Various Bugs That Let Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash, open channels, fill up queues, consume excessive log file space, or consume excessive voice mail space.

These vulnerabilities were detected using the Asteriod SIP denial-of-service tool, available at:

http://www.infiltrated.net/asteroid/

Jesus Oquendo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote or local user can cause a variety of denial of service conditions.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.2.13).

Title: Asterisk Integer Overflow in Skinny Channel Driver Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an integer overflow in the Asterisk Skinny channel driver for Cisco SCCP phones (chan_skinny.so) and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with root level privileges.

The vulnerability resides in the get_input() function in 'chan_skinny.c'.

1.4.0.x versions are not affected.

Adam Boileau of Security-Assessment.com discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued fixed versions (1.0.12, 1.2.13).

Title: Skype URI Handler Format String Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  Specially crafted arguments passed to the Skype URI handler can trigger this flaw.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.security-protocols.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=3259
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version of Skype for Mac (1.5.*.80 or later).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.skype.com/security/SKYPE-SB-2006-002.txt

Title: Asterisk Stack Overflow in MGCP Implementation Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted audit endpoint (AUEP) response message to trigger a stack overflow in the MGCP implementation and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Also, if an administrator uses a parameter that contains user-defined values as a filename input to the Record() function, code execution may be possible.

The vendor was notified on August 10, 2006.

The Mu Security research team discovered these vulnerabilities. 

The original advisory is available at:

http://labs.musecurity.com/advisories/MU-200608-01.txt
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch for the buffer overflow vulnerability, available at:

http://ftp.digium.com/pub/asterisk/asterisk-1.2.11-patch.gz

The report advises that users can protect against the Record() vulnerability by not using user-controlled variables (e.g., ${CALLERIDNAME}) as part of the filename argument.

Title: Cisco CallManager Express Lets Remote Users Determine SIP User Names
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager Express.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can supply specially crafted SIP requests to gain information from the SIP user directory.  A remote user can determine the names of the users stored in the SIP user database.

VoIP call processing and voice mail access are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCse92417 to this vulnerability.

Cisco CallManager is not vulnerable.

The vendor was notified on July 20, 2006.

Dave Endler and Mark Collier reported this vulnerability at the BlackHat USA 2006 conference.
Impact': A remote user can determine SIP user names.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20060802-sip.shtml

Title: AGEphone Buffer Overflow in 'sipd.dll' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Tan Chew Keong reported a vulnerability in AGEphone.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet via UDP to trigger a buffer overflow in 'sipd.dll' and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The original report is available at:

http://vuln.sg/agephone1381-en.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Unified CallManager Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified CallManager.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted hostname (in a SIP request, for example) to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The command line interface allows an authenticated administrator to execute arbitrary operating system programs with root privileges.  The interface also allows output of a command to be redirected to a file or a folder specified on the command line.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCse11005, CSCse31704, and CSCsd96542 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local administrator can gain root privileges.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version (5.0(4) and later).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060712-cucm.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Update for CallManager) RealVNC May Let Remote Users Connect Without Authenticating
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in RealVNC.  A remote user can access the target system.  Cisco CallManager is affected.
The authentication implementation may allow a remote user to connect to the target service without a password.  No further details were provided.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.intelliadmin.com/blog/2006/05/vnc-flaw-proof-of-concept.html

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.intelliadmin.com/blog/2006/05/security-flaw-in-realvnc-411.html

Steve Wiseman reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can connect to the target service without a password.
Solution:
Cisco CallManager includes RealVNC and is affected.  Cisco has issued an update for CallManager (win-OS-Upgrade-K9.2000-4-2sr8.exe) that includes the fixed version (4.1.2) of RealVNC, avialable at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/cmva-3des

Title: Cisco CallManager 'Administration' and 'User Options' Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web administration interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated administrative user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Cisco CallManager software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The "Cisco CallManager Administration" and "Cisco CallManager User Options" interfaces are affected.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/ccmadmin/phonelist.asp?findBy=description&match=begins&pattern=<script>alert
(document.cookie)</script>&submit1=Find&rows=20&wildcards=on&utilityList=

The vendor was notified on October 24, 2005.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsb68657 to this vulnerability.

Jake Reynolds of FishNet Security discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.fishnetsecurity.com/csirt/disclosure/cisco/Cisco+CallManager+XSS+Advisory.htm
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco CallManager software, access data recently submitted by the target administrative user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.  Cisco plans to issue a fix for the following versions:

    * 4.3(1)
    * 4.2(3)
    * 4.1(3)SR4
    * 3.3(5)SR3

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20060619-ccmxss.shtml

Title: Asterisk IAX2 Channel Driver Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to cause the target Asterisk server to crash or suffer from denial of service conditions.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (1.0.11, 1.2.9), available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/download
http://ftp.digium.com/pub/telephony/asterisk/releases

Title: Cisco CallManager TCP Connection Management Handling Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 3.2 and prior, 3.3 prior to 3.3(5)SR1a, 4.0 prior to 4.0(2a)SR2c, 4.1 prior to 4.1(3)SR2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can open a large number of TCP connections to port 2000 to consume excessive memory and CPU resources on the target system.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCea53907 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can open multiple TCP connections to ports 2001, 2002, or 7727 to fill up the Windows message queue.  As a result, the CallManager may not properly transact with the Windows Service Manager and may restart after a 30 second timeout period.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsa86197, CSCsb16635, and CSCsb64161 to this vulnerability.

One of the vendor's customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to consume excessive CPU resources, interrupt services, or reboot.  As a result, phones may not respond or may unregister from the Cisco CallManager.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions [3.3(5)SR1a, 4.0(2a)SR2c, 4.1(3)SR2].

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060118-ccmdos.shtml

Title: Cisco CallManager Bug Lets Read-Only Administrators Gain Full Administrator Privileges
Version(s): 3.2 and prior; 3.3 prior to 3.3(5)SR1; 4.0 prior to 4.0(2a)SR2c; 4.1 prior to 4.1(3)SR2.
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager.  A remote authenticated administrator can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
If Multi Level Administration (MLA) is enabled, a remote authenticated administrative user with read-only privileges can send a specially crafted URL to obtain full administrative access.

The administrative 'No Access' privilege level is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug IDs CSCef75361, CSCsb12765, CSCsb88649, and CSCsc26275 to this vulnerability.

Cisco credits CNLabs of Switzerland with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator with read-only privileges can gain full administrative privileges and create, delete, or reset devices.
Solution:
The vendor has provided a table of engineering and service release fixes in their advisory, available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060118-ccmpe.shtml

Title: eStara Softphone Buffer Overflow in SIP SDP Attribute Field May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in eStara Softphone.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
A remote user can send a SIP packet with specially crafted SDP data to the target system to trigger a buffer overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A packet with more than 4021 bytes in the attribute field can trigger the overflow.

ZwelL reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Interaction SIP Proxy Buffer Overflow in SIPParser() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Hat-Squad Security Team reported a vulnerability in the Interaction SIP Proxy.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can connect to the target proxy and send a specially crafted SIP request to trigger a heap overflow in 'i3sipmsg.dll' and cause the proxy to crash.  A remote user can send 2900 bytes of space characters (0x20) or TAB characters (0x9) as the SIP version value in a REGISTER request line to trigger the overflow in the SIPParser() function.

The Vonexus Enterprise Interaction Center is also affected.

The vendor was notified on December 11, 2005.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.hat-squad.com/i3sip.html

Behrang Fouladi of Hat-Squad Security Team discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.hat-squad.com/en/000171.html
Impact': A remote user can cause the proxy to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.0.011), available at:

http://www.inin.com/sipproxy/termsandconditions/termsandconditions.aspx?l=t

Title: Asterisk Web-Voicemail Discloses Voicemail Messages to Remote Authenticated Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the Web-Voicemail feature.  A remote authenticated user can access voicemail messages of other users.
The 'vmail.cgi' script does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted URL to download WAV files from the target system.

A demonstration exploit URL to retrieve 'msg0001.wav' from the '/var/spool/asterisk/voicemail/default/201/INBOX/' directory is provided:

http://[target]/cgi-bin/vmail.cgi?action=audio& \
folder=../201/INBOX&mailbox=200&context=default&password=12345 \
&msgid=0001&format=wav

The vendor was notified on October 18, 2005.

Adam Pointon of Assurance.com.au discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.assurance.com.au/advisories/200511-asterisk.txt
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access WAV files from the target PBX system, including voicemail messages of other users.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.2.0-beta2).

Title: Ventrilo Service Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
Luigi Auriemma reported a vulnerability was reported in Ventrilo.  A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted UDP status query packet to the target service with less data than is specified in the query header to trigger a flaw in Ventrilo.  The software does not properly handle this exception and may terminate.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://aluigi.altervista.org/poc/ventboom.zip
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The report indicates that, as a workaround, you can filter to reject UDP packets on the service port (3784 by default).

Title: Skype Unsafe Temporary File When Adding Pictures to Profiles May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype, affecting Linux-based systems.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
When a user adds a picture to their profile, the software creates a temporary file in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from the temporary filename ('/tmp/skype_profile.jpg') to a critical file on the system.  Then, when the target user adds a picture, the symlinked file may be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

The vendor was notified on April 14, 2005.

Giovanni Delvecchio reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain the privileges of the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco CallManager Memory Management Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 3.2 and prior versions; 3.3 prior to 3.3(5); 4.0 prior to 4.0(2a)SR2b; 4.1 prior to 4.1(3)SR1
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco CallManager.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may also be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
The software does not properly timeout Realtime Information Server Data Collection (RISDC) sockets.  As a result, the 'RisDC.exe' process may consume excessive amounts of memory and may fail to close sockets.  Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCed37403 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can repeatedly send specially crafted packets to cause the CTI Manager (ctimgr.exe) to consume more than 1 GB of memory and restart.  Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCee00116 to this vulnerability.  The vendor was notified of this vulnerability on April 21, 2005.

A remote user can repeatedly send specially crafted packets to cause the 'ccm.exe' process to allocate excessive memory (500 MB).  Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCee00118 to this vulnerability.

When Multi Level Admin (MLA) is enabled, a remote user can perform a failed login attempt to trigger a memory leak in the Admin Service Tool.  This can be repeated to consume up to 750 MB of memory.  Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCef47060 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted packets to the aupair service (aupair.exe) to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the service to terminate or potentially execute arbitrary code.  Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsa75554 to this vulnerability.

Cisco credits Jeff Fay from PatchAdvisor with reporting one of the vulnerabilities (CSCee00116).  Cisco credits Internet Security Systems with reporting one of the vulnerabilities (CSCsa75554).
Impact':
A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions, which may also affected related IP telephony services.  Denial of service conditions may include high CPU utilization, unresponsive terminal services, the inability to run CCM Admin, or the inability to map drives.  Phones may be unresponsive, phones may unregister from CallManager, or CallManager may restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following Maintenance Release versions:  3.3(5), 4.1(4).

The vendor has issued the following Service Release versions:  4.0(2a)SR2b, 4.1(3)SR1.

Some additional special release fixes are available.  A patch matrix is provided in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050712-ccm.shtml

Title: Asterisk Buffer Overflow in Manager Interface Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk in the manager interface.  A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted command string to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code. The code will (typically) run with root privileges.

A command string composed two double quote characters followed by a tab character, with this sequence repeating, can trigger the flaw.

The manager interface is not enabled by default.

The vendor was notified on May 19, 2005.

Wade Alcorn from Portcullis discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.portcullis-security.com/advisory/advisory-05-013.txt
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.0.8), available at:

http://www.asterisk.org/index.php?menu=download

As a workaround, the manager interface can be disabled via the 'manager.conf' file.

Title: Cisco 802.1x Voice-Enabled Interfaces Grant Anonymous Voice VLAN Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager and Cisco voice-enabled switches.  A remote user on the local network can spoof the Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) to gain anonymous voice VLAN access.
Cisco IP Phones do not currently contain 802.1x supplicants.  As a result, phones are authorized to join the voice VLAN without 802.1x authentication.

Enterprises that use 802.1x port-level authentication for VLAN data access and also use IP telephony may have a false sense of security regarding VLAN access.

FishNet Security reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.fishnetsecurity.com/csirt/disclosure/cisco/Cisco+802.1x+Advisory.aspx
Impact': A remote user on the local network can gain anonymous voice VLAN access.
Solution:
Cisco has provided the following workaround instructions in their Security Notice [quoted]:

Customers running newer versions of software on their Cisco Catalyst switches can take advantage of a number of features which can aid in limiting what a device can do while on the network. These features include, but are not limited to, DHCP Snooping and Port Security, Dynamic ARP Inspection (DAI) and IP Source Guard.

The whitepaper entitled Cisco Catalyst Integrated Security-Enabling the Self-Defending Network introduces the features on the Catalyst switches which can mitigate Layer 2 and Layer 3 attacks against the switch and devices connected through it.

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/hw/switches/ps708/products_white_paper0900aecd8015f0ae.shtml

Additionally, customers running newer versions of Cisco CallManager can take advantage of features now offered on the Cisco IP Phones and CallManager to address Layer 2 and Layer 3 based network attacks, including certificate based authentication and encryption of voice signaling and media to protect the identity, integrity, and privacy of all voice communications.

The product data sheet for Cisco CallManager Version 4.1 lists the features available for further protection of the CallManager and IP Phones.

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/voicesw/ps556/products_data_sheet0900aecd801979f0.html


The Cisco Security Notice is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/voicesw/ps556/products_security_notice09186a008048e0d6.html

Additional workaround suggestions are availabe in the FishNet Security advisory at:

http://www.fishnetsecurity.com/csirt/disclosure/cisco/Cisco+802.1x+Advisory.aspx

Title: (Vendor Issues Fix) Skype Error in Processing 'callto://' URLs Lets Remote Users Crash the Application
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype in the processing of 'callto://' URLs.  A remote user can cause the target user's application to crash.
Hillel Himovich reported that the following URL can trigger the flaw:

callto://aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/

The report indicates that it may be possible to execute arbitrary code, but this was not confirmed.

In November 2004, Fabian Becker reported a similar vulnerability in the quick-call field.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's application to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.0.0.100), available at:

http://www.skype.com/products/skype/windows/

Title: Skype Error in Processing 'callto://' URLs Lets Remote Users Crash the Application
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Skype in the processing of 'callto://' URLs.  A remote user can cause the target user's application to crash.
Hillel Himovich reported that the following URL can trigger the flaw:

callto://aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/

The report indicates that it may be possible to execute arbitrary code, but this was not confirmed.

In November 2004, Fabian Becker reported a similar vulnerability in the quick-call field.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's application to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) OpenH323 PWLib Contains H.323/H.225 Processing Errors
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PWLib after the code was tested against the NISCC [OUSPG] OpenH323 test suite.  The impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.
The flaw reportedly affects the H.225 protocol implementation.  A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to an application that implements PWLib to trigger the flaw.  The impact will depend on the specific application, but can include denial of service.
Impact':
The specific impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.  The impact can include remote denial of service.

[Editor's note:  The reports on this vulnerability were not specific regarding the impact, but it is important to note that some of the vulnerabilities discovered by the NISCC H.323 test suite may result in arbitrary code execution.]
Solution:
Gentoo has released a fix and advises that all pwlib users upgrade to version 1.5.2-r3 or later:

     # emerge sync

     # emerge -pv ">=dev-libs/pwlib-1.5.2-r3"
     # emerge ">=dev-libs/pwlib-1.5.2-r3"

Title: Avaya Converged Communication Server Buffer Overflow in Processing SIP Packets Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Avaya Converged Communication Server in the processing of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target server.
Avaya reported that the Avaya Converged Communication Server contains a buffer overflow vulnerability in the implementation of the SIP protocol.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.

The vulnerabilities were discovered by running the c07-sip test suite (http://www.ee.oulu.fi/research/ouspg/protos/testing/c07/sip/) that was produced by the Oulu University Secure Programming Group (OUSPG).

All versions of the Avaya Converged Communication Server are reported to be affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.  A patch is not yet available.  However, Avaya indicates that customers should follow certain workarounds that are described in the advisory.

The advisory is available at:

http://support.avaya.com/security

Title: PicoPhone Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Luigi Auriemma reported a buffer overflow vulnerability in PicoPhone.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
It is reported that the logging function (enabled by default) contains a buffer overflow.  A remote user can reportedly send a specially crafted packet to trigger the overflow and cause the software to crash or execute arbitrary code.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://aluigi.altervista.org/poc/picobof.zip
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's application to crash or to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (1.64), available at:

http://www.vitez.it/picophone/PicoPhone164.exe

Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) OpenH323 PWLib Contains H.323/H.225 Processing Errors
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PWLib after the code was tested against the NISCC [OUSPG] OpenH323 test suite.  The impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.
The flaw reportedly affects the H.225 protocol implementation.  A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to an application that implements PWLib to trigger the flaw.  The impact will depend on the specific application, but can include denial of service.
Impact':
The specific impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.  The impact can include remote denial of service.

[Editor's note:  The reports on this vulnerability were not specific regarding the impact, but it is important to note that some of the vulnerabilities discovered by the NISCC H.323 test suite may result in arbitrary code execution.]

Title: Avirt Voice Has a Remote Buffer Overflow
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in Avirt Voice.  A remote user may be able to cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.
Donato Ferrante reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted request to the target system on TCP port 1080 to trigger a buffer overflow.

A demonstration exploit request is provided:

GET aaaa[ 1113 of a ]aaaa
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause the application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [however, the report did not disclose the specific impact.]
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.  The vendor reportedly plans to issue a fix in the next version of the product.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) OpenH323 PWLib Contains H.323/H.225 Processing Errors
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PWLib after the code was tested against the NISCC [OUSPG] OpenH323 test suite.  The impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.
The flaw reportedly affects the H.225 protocol implementation.  A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to an application that implements PWLib to trigger the flaw.  The impact will depend on the specific application, but can include denial of service.
Impact':
The specific impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.  The impact can include remote denial of service.

[Editor's note:  The reports on this vulnerability were not specific regarding the impact, but it is important to note that some of the vulnerabilities discovered by the NISCC H.323 test suite may result in arbitrary code execution.]

Debian has released a fix for the current stable distribution (woody) in version 1.2.5-5woody1.  A fix for the unstable distribution (sid) will be available soon.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix for RH Enterprise Linux) OpenH323 PWLib Contains H.323/H.225 Processing Errors
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PWLib after the code was tested against the NISCC [OUSPG] OpenH323 test suite.  The impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.
The flaw reportedly affects the H.225 protocol implementation.  A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to an application that implements PWLib to trigger the flaw.  The impact will depend on the specific application, but can include denial of service.
Impact':
The specific impact depends on the application that uses PWLib.  The impact can include remote denial of service.

[Editor's note:  The reports on this vulnerability were not specific regarding the impact, but it is important to note that some of the vulnerabilities discovered by the NISCC H.323 test suite may result in arbitrary code execution.]
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Cisco Internet Service Node is Affected) Microsoft Windows Workstation Service (wkssvc.dll) Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code with System Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Cisco reported that Cisco Internet Service Node appliances are affected by the Windows 2000 Workstation Service vulnerability. A remote user can execute arbitrary code with System privileges on the target system.
It is reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted message to the Workstation service to cause the service to crash or execute arbitrary code with System level privileges.  Other attack vectors can reportedly be used.  For example, a remote authenticated user can login and send malformed messages to the service or an application that passes messages to the service can be exploited.

The flaw exists in the Wkssvc.dll file.

The Workstation service is used to route local file system requests and remote file or print network requests and is enabled by default, according to the report.

Microsoft indicates that if you have blocked inbound UDP ports 138, 139, 445 and TCP ports 138, 139, 445 with a firewall, a remote user cannot send messages to the Workstation service.

Microsoft credits eEye Digital Security with reporting this flaw.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for affected Cisco IP Telephony Applications: for all versions of Cisco CallManager and all compatible versions of Cisco IP Interactive Voice Response (IP IVR), Cisco IP Call Center Express (IPCC Express), Cisco Personal Assistant (PA), Cisco Emergency Responder (CER), Cisco Conference Connection (CCC), and Cisco Internet Service Node (ISN).  The vendor advises customers to apply the win-OS-Upgrade-k9.2000-2-5sr4.exe or later package located at the following URL:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/cmva-3des?psrtdcat20e2

Title: Cisco Internet Service Node Default Configuration on IBM Servers Grants Administrative Access to Remote Users
Version(s): Systems on IBM Hardware with OS version prior to OS 2000.2.6
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Internet Service Node (ISN) when installed on IBM servers.  A remote user can gain administrative access to the system.  A remote user can also cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Cisco reported that the default installation of several Cisco voice products on the IBM platform leaves the Director Agent configured in an unsecure state.  As a result, a remote user can conduct denial of service attacks or gain administrative access.

The report indicates that a remote user can connect to port 14247 and gain administrative access without having to authenticate.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCed33037 to this flaw.

A remote user can also conduct a portscan against port 14247 to cause the IBM Director Agent process (twgipc.exe) to consume 100% of the CPU.  A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.  Director Agent versions 2.2 and 3.11 are reportedly affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCed23357 to this flaw.

The following IBM server model numbers are reportedly affected: IBM X330 (8654 or 8674), IBM X340, IBM X342, IBM X345, MCS-7815-1000, MCS-7815I-2.0, MCS-7835I-2.4, and MCS-7835I-3.0.  Operating system (OS) versions prior to OS 2000.2.6 on the IBM servers are vulnerable.
Impact':
A remote user can gain administrative access to the application.

A remote user can cause the CPU utilization to reach 100%.
Solution: The vendor reports that this vulnerability can be resolved by making configuration changes.  Cisco is providing a repair script to close the vulnerable ports and configure the Director Agent in a secure state.  No upgrade is required.
